La Sra. Myriam es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está en pareja con él con el Sr. Reinaldo, con quien tiene hijos, ya todos mayores e independientes que hoy están cursando la universidad.
Myrian tiene un taller de costuras en su casa y a la vez, ella y su esposo  en una empresa de confecciones de ropas. Gracias al trabajo que están haciendo educan a sus hijos, y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar. 
Ella  es una persona muy responsable y honesta, cuenta que tiene clientela  formada  y cantidad de trabajos.Solicita este crédito para la compra de una maquina  industrial, ya que esto le agilizará mucho su trabajo y podrá hacer una mayor producción para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Myriam is from the city of San Lorenzo and is married to Reinaldo with whom she has grown children who are attending the university.

Myriam has a seamstress shop in her home and together she and her husband have a business making clothing. Thanks to this work they have been able to educate their children and buy all their household necessities. 

She is a very responsible and honest person. She says that she has an established clientele and a good amount of work. She is requesting this loan to buy an industrial sewing machine as this will streamline her work and increase her production for her customers.

loans.use: purchase an industrial sewing machine to use in her sewing shop.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз 29 лет, воспитывает четверых детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 10 лет назад Кундуз начала свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота, стартовав с покупки одной дойной коровы. Молоко и молочные продукты, такие как айран (кисломолочный продукт), сметана, творог Кундуз продает на местном базаре. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 40коровы, 2 лошади и 30 овец.Такая деятельность позволяет Кундуз зарабатывать около 15,000 сом (KGS)в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кундуз обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Кундуз планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает дать достойное образование своим детям.
texts.en: Kunduz is 29 years old and is raising four children.  In search of income for her family, 10 years ago Kunduz started her business raising and reselling livestock, starting with the purchase of one milk cow.  Kunduz sells milk and dairy products such as ayran (a yogurt beverage), sour cream and farmer's cheese at the local market.  Today, her holdings include 40 cows, 2 horses and 30 sheep.  This business allows Kunduz to earn around 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further grow her business, Kunduz turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock.  Kunduz plans to invest her earning into further increasing her livestock count.  In the future she hopes to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline lives in Tiribe and is married with one child. Her husband is employed and he contributes to the family's basic needs. 

Pauline says that her husband is working and that thanks to his help they are able to provide basic needs for the family, but as it is still not enough money she began raising chickens and selling them for profit to help with the household expenses.

She is asking for this loan to buy chickens as well as feed and vitamins.

loans.use: to buy chickens as well as feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 39-year-old man. He describes himself as a business-oriented man. He operates a motorcycle and provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a favorable business environment for transportation services and his primary customers are general residents from the area and village. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent breakdown of the motorcycle. 

He will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy potatoes and carrots to start a new business, a retail business. His business goal is to buy a van to increase the mode of transportation services within five years. This is his seventh loan with SMEP DTM after managing to pay a loan of KES 95,000 back successfully.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and carrots to start a retail business.

loans.name: Pola's Group

texts.en:
Pola is a forty-six year old mother of six. She is a small scale farmer who also makes charcoal for sale in the markets. Her husband is a day-laborer. She faces many challenges in her work, but primarily she is concerned that her crop yield is not enough to feed her family and the trees she uses to make charcoal are scarce. 

She is excited to work with KOMAZA because she likes the community aspect of the work, and is impressed with the KOMAZA field staff's way of approaching her community and trusts them to educate them on tree farming. She hopes to use the extra income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a Lebanese married man. He’s 48 years old and has three children. He’s really attached to his family. Cooperating together, Hasan and his wife were capable of covering their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. He started his business as car mechanic. He’s specialized in car electricity. 

He had to work really hard to prove that he can provide the necessary support for his family, and clearly, he has gained a large number of customers who seek his services. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay fees for his children's studies. One of his greatest dreams is to see them achieving higher positions. Hasan seeks to develop his work in the near future so he can better support his family.

loans.use: to pay fees for his children’s studies.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
San Isidro es un grupo que se formo a partir de la idea de progreso que tuvieron estas mujeres. Todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se han unido para poder trabajar en conjunto y ayudarse las unas a las otras en la lucha del día a día.
Fatima es una de estas mujeres, es una persona muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de crecer y salir adelante. Tiene una pequeña peluquería en la que trabaja todos los días atendiendo a una diversidad de clientela. Se define como una persona muy buena en lo que hace y es por eso que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Por eso solicita de este crédito para poder comprar insumos para su salón, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, tijeras, peines y demás, ya que con esto podrá seguir dando una buena atención y manteniendo a su clientela muy a gusto.
texts.en:
The "San Isidro" group was born out of the idea of progress that these women had.  All the women are heads of their families who have come together to work and help each other in their day-to-day struggles.

Fatima is one of the members - she is very enthusiastic and has a strong desire to grow and move forward.  She has a small hairdressing salon where she works every day serving a variety of customers.  She defines herself as being very good at what she does and it is for this reason that she wants to continue investing in her business.  So, she is applying for this loan to buy supplies for her salon, such as dyes, shampoo, conditioner, creams, scissors, combs and other items.  With all this Fatima will be able to continue providing good service and keeping her customers happy.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, conditioner, creams, scissors, combs and other items.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana earns a living through her food-vending business selling home cooked snack foods to the people in her place in Talibon, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and margarine. With this, she could cook and sell more thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Cipriana hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and margarine.

loans.name: Phidilia

texts.en:
Phidilia is a 43-year-old nursery school proprietor in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children who is also supported by her husband. She has been in this business for the last four years and has done well. 

This marks her fifth loan from KADET Ltd. to purchase building materials like cement, sand and ballast for the expansion of the classrooms. 

She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and purchase furniture for the children. She hopes to grow her school into an education complex.

loans.use: to purchase building materials like cement, sand and ballast.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen is 18 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal  region of Uganda. For the past three years, Moureen has been working hard to manage her business which sells beans.

To help expand her business, Moureen has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve the business and add more and different types of beans to sell. This will  help Moureen to generate greater profits and help generate income. Moureen hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.  

Moureen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to improve the business and add more and different types of beans to sell.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнара 48 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Гульнара в качестве основного источника дохода занимается животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 4,000 сом (KGS) после развала СССР, благодаря упорному труду Гульнара смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 12,000 сом (KGS).На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 10 лошади и 40 голов овец. Благодаря прибыли от хозяйства, Гульнара оплачивает затраты на основные нужды семьи. Гульнара продает с дома молоко и молочную продукцию. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульнара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки дополнительных голов овец. Что позволит увеличить доходы от перепродажи скота. Доходы от кредита Гульнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства и в будущем хочет приобрести холодильник для дома.
texts.en: Gulnara is 48 years old, she is married and has 4 children.  Gulnara raises livestock as the main source of income.  Having started this business with 4,000 som (KGS) after the breakup of the USSR, thanks to her hard work, Gulnara was able to expand her holdings to a monthly profit of 12,000 som (KGS).  Today her holdings include 10 horses and 40 sheep.  Thanks to profits from her holdings, Gulnara pays for her family's needs.  Gulnara sells milk and dairy products out of her home.  In order to further grow her business, Gulnara turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of more sheep.  This will allow her to increase her income from reselling livestock.  Gulnara plans to invest the profits from the loan into further growing her business and in the future would like to buy a refrigerator for her home.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Temotea

texts.en:
Temotea is a 61-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She is engaged in a fishing business together with her husband. 

Temotea is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and lead weights. With this, they will be able to improve their fishing business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and lead weights.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol. She has operated a videoke/karaoke machines business in her place for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. 

Lolita is asking for a loan buy another set of machines for the expansion of her business. With this, she will be able to improve her earnings and profit. In the future, Lolita hopes to make her business a success. In addition she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: buy another set of machines for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is now 29 years happily living with his two children. His cafeteria business is doing well and his monthly income has increased to KES 25,000.

He is has now asked for his 3rd loan of KES 35,000 from KADET Ltd. which he intends to use to purchase a stock of wheat flour, tea leaves, fresh milk, cooking fat and sugar. The profits that he gets will be used to pay school fees for his school-going children.

His dream is to have a happy family and also prosperity in business.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of wheat flour, tea leaves, fresh milk, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 60 years old, and is a widow with seven children. 

Lourdes is in the agricultural business pig-fattening in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lourdes has been pig-fattening for six years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. He has two children and has been doing this work for 13 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Being able to meet the family's need from agriculture!' His biggest challenge is 'livestock disease outbreaks affecting production and causing death of animals. 

He will use the loan of 52,000 KES he has requested to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Joel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Knew about Juhudi from a neighbour.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to boost production through micro finance.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Joel replied 'Acquire a dairy cow to boost production.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joel owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 61-year-old woman. She is married to Joseph and a mother of one child. She is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for 10 years. Esther gets a monthly income of 18,000 shillings.

This will be Esther's third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, she wants to become a better farmer and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase a  dairy cow.

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru:
Тохир житель города Дангара. Он 28 летний женатый молодой человек. У Тохира двое детей, дочка и сын. Его дети маленькие. Тохир живет вместе с семьей. Образование у Тохира среднее. Он очень добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Не смотря на трудности жизни он не унывает. 
Тохир более пяти лет занимается торговлей. На сегодняшний день у него собственный небольшой магазин. Тохир занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров. Он открыл магазин у себя дома, чтобы жители могли приобрести необходимые товары недалеко от дома. 
Тохир берет кредит для покупки продуктов и прохладительных напитков. Он намерен увеличить оборот.
texts.en:
Tohir is a resident of the city of Dangara.  He is a 28 year old, married, young man.  Tohir has two children, a daughter and a son.  His children are young.  Tohir lives with his family.  Tohir has a high school education.  He is a very kind and hardworking person.  Despite difficulties in life he does not get discouraged.

Tohir has worked in sales for more then five years.  Today he has his own small store.  Tohir sells household products.  He opened the store at his home, so that residents could buy needed products close to home.

Tohir is taking out a loan to buy food items and cold drinks.  He is determined to increase his turnover.

loans.use: to buy food items and cold beverages in order to increase turnover and expand the store in the future

loans.name: Betty Jane

texts.en:
Betty Jane engages in growing vegetables in their field. She grows variety of vegetables and sells them in their village. Betty Jane has been in this business for 20 years and it is her source of income from which she sustains her family's basic needs. 

Betty Jane is 49 years old, married and has three children. She has two children that she sends to school who are getting a college-level of education. With regards to her vegetable business, Betty Jane is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow. 

Betty Jane hopes that through her income from vending of vegetables, she will successfully send her children to college and allow them to finish their education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 21 years old. He lives in Khulo District with his wife Natia and his parents. Ramin requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family owns a plot of agricultural land where fruits and vegetables are grown. They also have a milk cow which is milked to make cheese. Harvested products and the cheese are sold locally at the markets and family gets a small monthly income.

Ramin requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Ramin will open a café. He already has rented a place and now he needs to purchase the entire inventory that he needs.  The place he rented is in a crowded area so Ramin hopes he will have a lot of clients and earn a good monthly income. With the profit he will improve the conditions of his café. An increased monthly income will give Ramin a chance to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase the entire inventory needed for opening a cafe.

loans.name: Kholida

texts.ru:
Холида проживает в районе Зафаробод, города Истаравшан на севере страны. Холида замужем. Ей 28 лет. Она живет с мужем, свекровью и свекром. Еще с ними живет ее сестренка. У Холиды маленький сын. Она занимается домашним хозяйством и заботиться о сыне. Кроме того она занимается бизнесом. Она трудолюбивая женщина. Холида старается во улучшении условий проживания. Холида разводит крупно - рогатый скот для продажи. Еще она разводит овец и коз у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности Холида занимается более восьми лет, она имеет богатый опыт в этой области. 
Холида берет кредит для закупа коров и бычков.
texts.en:
Kholida lives in the Zafarobod neighborhood in the city of Istaravshan in the north of the country.  Kholida is married.  She is 28 years old.  She lives with her husband, mother in law and father in law.  Her younger sister lives with them too.  Kholida has a young son.  She takes care of the home and of her son.  In addition, she has a business.  She is a hardworking woman.  Kholida tries hard to improve her living conditions.  Kholida raises large horned livestock for sale.  She also raises sheep and goats at home.  Kholida has been in this business for over eight years, she has a lot of experience in this area.  

Kholida is taking out a loan to buy cows and calfs.

loans.use: to buy cows and calfs in order to grow her business and improve her living conditions

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a married mother of five who describes herself as a determined and trustworthy woman, has been operating a dairy farm selling milk for 40 years now. Her enterprise is located within a favorable business environment, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

Lucy will use this, her second loan with SMEP DTM after repaying a previous one for Kes 20,000, to pay school fees. Her business goal is to buy another dairy cow within five years.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 53 years of age and has been a widow for 3 years. She is blessed with three grown-up children. 

Julita operates her transportation business - particularly motorcycle transport. She owns two units for motorcycle transport. Aside from transportation, she is also engaged in selling fish as her additional source of income.

Julita plans to buy a carrier for her motorcycle and new wheels but she struggles with a shortage of capital. With her determination to get ahead of life, she is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000. She hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted so she can give her family a better way of life and secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy a carrier for her motorcycle transport and new wheels for her transportation business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a seaweed farming business together with her husband for more than 2 years now. Seaweed farming is a lucrative business in the Philippines. 

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy more seaweed seedlings. With this, they will be able to improve their seaweed farming ventures.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 46 years of age and is married with three children. She runs her snack house or refreshment stall. She has had this kind of business for 5 years. 

Alona would like to increase the cases of soft drinks, kilograms of raw pork meat, and hot dogs that she offers within her locality. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of PHP 9,000. She believes that this loan amount will keep her business progressive and profitable, most especially this harvest season. 

Alona hopes and prays that her food stall or refreshment stall will grow further for her to have a better way of living and earn better income. In this way, her one child can finish her studies and she can save some money for family emergencies.

loans.use: to buy kilograms of raw pork meat, ingredients, cases of soft drinks, and hot dogs for her food stall.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru:
Илхом житель города Истаравшан. Ему 33 года. В его семье пятеро человек. Он живет с женой и с детьми. У него трое детей, двое дочерей и сын. Илхом порядочный и ответственный человек. Он один обеспечивает свою семью.
Илхом вместе с братом работает в пекарне. Он печет лепешки для продажи. В этой области он более десяти лет. Илхом берет кредит для покупки муки, чтобы увеличить количество горячих и свежих лепешек.
texts.en:
Ilhom is a resident of the city of Istaravhan.  He is 33 years old.  His family has five people.  He lives with his wife and children.  He has three children, two daughters and a son.  Ilhom is an upstanding and responsible person.  He provides for his family by himself.

Ilhom and his brother work in a bakery.  He bakes flatbread for sale.  He has worked in this sphere for over ten years.  Ilhom is taking out a loan to buy flour in order to increase the amount of hot and fresh flatbread.

loans.use: to buy flour in order to increase the quantity of hot and fresh flatbread

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah has been involved in direct selling, rice farming and a livestock business. She has managed her direct selling and her rice field for ten years, and the livestock business for two years. 

Leah aspires to maintain all her businesses, but at this time she struggles for shortage of capital that's the reason why she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000. She will be using this loan to buy cosmetic products, perfumes, sandals, shoes, blouses and pants for her direct selling business. She hopes that this loan amount will be granted for her dreams to be fulfilled someday.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products, perfumes, sandals, shoes, blouses and pants for her direct selling  business

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman and very hard-working. She has a partner, and they have one child. They have been living in Tiribe. Chizi has a posho mill, grinding maize for flour. She says her job is very demanding. Her dream is to buy another posho mill machine in order to meet her customers' needs and so progress every day.

She is applying for this loan and will invest it in purchase of fuel and running tools. This loan will let her invest in her only work and only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and running tools.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita manages a variety store, hog-raising and a corn-farming business. She is business-oriented woman, happily married to a farmer having four grown-up children. Merlita's main goal in life is to have a stable source of income so she could have a comfortable way of life someday.

Merlita plans to buy a stock of grocery items such as canned goods, cooking oil, eggs, assorted biscuits and ingredients for her general store but due to insufficient funds she has had to request a loan of PHP 10,000. She hopes to obtain this amount of loan for her dreams to be fulfilled someday.

Merlita would be thankful enough if her requested loan is granted.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, cooking oil, eggs, assorted biscuits and ingredients for her general store.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily (pictured here with her dairy cows though requesting poultry loan) lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has 8 children and has been doing this work for 4 years.  Her primary income sources are selling milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Feeding cow!' Her biggest challenge is 'Digging.' The animal in the farm is named "Chebois". She will use the loan to buy poultry birds.

Emily was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Grace period issue and low interest rate.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It has low interest rate.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Emily replied 'It will get more income to meet family needs.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Emily owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet's group is comprised of four hard-working women. Annet is 21 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal  region of Uganda. She is 21 and has two children with both of them currently in school. For the past two years, Annet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells books, soap and other products. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase stock and buy more items such as books, soap and other products. It will help Annet  to generate greater profits and boost the business. Annet  hopes that in the future she will be able to be self-reliant.

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase stock and buy more items such as books, soap and other products.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 30-year-old married woman, the mother of two young children. She and her husband have been in the fishing business for more than four years.

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights.
 
In the future, Imelda hope to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights for her fishing business.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Гулбахор проживает в городе Дангара, на юго-западе страны. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое сыновей и одна дочка. Старший сын Гулбахор военный, младший сын занимается строительными работами. Дочь Гулбахор окончила школу, она домохозяйка, помогает матери по хозяйству. 
Гулбахор имеет среднее образование. Она девять лет проработала на рынке. Гулбахор арендовала торговую точку на рынке, где продавала одежду. На сегодняшний день у Гулбахор небольшой продуктовый магазин у себя дома. Она занимается торговлей вместе с дочерью. В этой области она уже год.  
Гулбахор берет кредит для покупки продуктов и хозяйственных товаров.
texts.en:
Gulbahor lives in the city Dangara, in the southwest of the country.  She is 46 years old.  She is married.  She has two sons and one daughter.  Gulbahor's eldest son is a soldier, the younger son is a construction worker.  Gulbahor's daughter finished school, she is a homemaker, helping her mother run the house.

Gulbahor has a high school education.  She worked at the market for nine years.  Gulbahor rented a sales location at the market where she sold clothing.  Today Gulbahor has a small grocery store in her home.  She works in sales with her daughter.  She has had this business for a year now.  

Gulbahor is taking out a loan to buy grocery and household items.

loans.use: to buy sugar, drinks, legumes and household products

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco trabajó durante 35 años como servidor público por lo que actualmente es jubilado; sin embargo, siempre ha sido una persona muy activa y se consideró aún muy productivo, fue así que decidió desde hace 7 años ya, emprender un negocio propio, dedicarse a la venta de tacos al vapor, que es una comida típica de la ciudad de Monterrey; es casado y con 3 hijos mayores de edad. Tiene una nieta de 18 años que suele ayudarle en el negocio, lo cual le da mucho gusto y satisfacción pues ese apoyo considera que es una expresión de cariño, la venta de sus tacos se da principalmente en las mañanas (entre las 7 y 12 horas) por lo que  todos los días se despierta a las 4 a.m. para preparar; como expresa el Sr. Francisco: “los mejores tacos al vapor de Monterrey”
Piensa invertir su crédit en la compra de sillas y mesas, para poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, pues se ha incrementado la demanda. El sueño del Sr. Francisco es llegar a tener una taquería grande en el centro de la ciudad y que llegue a ser reconocida por sus ricos tacos y después dejarla como herencia para sus hijos y nietos y que ellos la trabajen.
texts.en:
Francisco worked as a public servant for 35 years. He is currently retired however he has always been a very active person and considered himself still very productive. 

This is how, seven years ago, he decided to start his own tacos al vapor  [steamed tacos]  business which is a typical food in the city of Monterrey. 

He is married with three grown children. 

His eighteen year old granddaughter tends to help him with the business. This gives him much joy and satisfaction since he considers this help a term of endearment. 

He sells the tacos mainly in the mornings (between 7am-12pm) therefore he wakes up at 4am to prepare, as he says, "the best tacos al vapor in Monterrey"

He plans on investing his loan in chairs and tables in order to give a better service to his clients, since demand has increased. 

Franciscos dream is to have a big taco restaurant in the middle of the city and that he becomes known for his delicious tacos.  

He can then leave this as inheritance for his children and grandchildren for them to manage.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Caaguazu Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Caaguazu Poty está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse. Ellas están muy entusiasmadas por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias, para que de esa forma no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ellas pasaron.
Alicia es parte de este grupo, además que es la presidenta. Cuenta que ella quiere motivar a sus compañeras a luchar por ss ideales y que no se dejen vencer. Alicia es comerciante, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa, y con esto está saliendo adelante. Empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero con esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos de primera necesidad para surtir su negocio con: arroz, fideos, verduras, leche, productos de limpieza, y demás, y con esto seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
The Caaguazu Poty group is in its first cycle with the Women’s Committee program.  They are learning to work together and to help each other.  They are very enthusiastic about getting ahead and helping their families.  This way their families will not have to do without like the members had to do.

Alicia is part of this group, and she is the president.  She says that she wants to motivate her colleagues to work for their principles and to not give up.  

Alicia is a merchant, and she has a well-stocked store in her house.  With the store she is getting ahead.  She started with a small business, but with effort she is getting ahead.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy basic needs supplies.  She will stock her store with rice, noodles, vegetables, milk, cleaning products, and others.  With this she will continue working and getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, vegetables, milk, cleaning products, and others.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has been engaged in farming, chicken-raising and a variety store. Her spouse works as farmer and carpenter within her locality. Josefina's variety store has been 11 years in operation. She is thankful because throughout those years of operation, she has been able to manage it well due to her continuous access to financial assistance from microfinance institutions. 

Now, she plans to re-stock her variety store but her capital is not sufficient. With regards to this situation, she is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 which will allow her to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, junk foods, instant noodles and eggs for her variety store.

She hopes that her requested loan amount will be approved so she could earn a better income, enabling her to improve her way of living and save some amount for her emergency purposes when she and her spouse get weak.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, junk foods, instant noodles and eggs for her retail store.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita manages a furniture business in their village. She is 47 years of age and has four children attending school. Merlita and her husband have managed the business for almost 28 years. They started the business without machines; they use their own techniques to run the business. Their profits from the business serve as their children's allowances for school and bestow their daily needs.

Merlita sells dining sets, beds, chairs and tables. Merlita wishes for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy wood and burnishing materials to beautify the furniture they sell. Merlita hopes that by beautifying the products they sell it will encourage customers to buy and generate higher income. Through the income this generates, she will financially support their children's needs for school.

loans.use: to buy wood and burnishing materials to beautify the furniture they sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is married with five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal and generates additional income from rental rooms. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and defaulters. She aspires to sell wholesale only, to educate her children up to university, and to get enough profits to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Kahindi's Group

texts.en:
Khindi is a 53 year-old farmer with nine children. His wife cares for their home. He faces many challenges in his farming from the frequent droughts, and also wishes he made enough from his farm to be able to pay wages for additional help. 

Khindi is excited to join the KOMAZA microforestry program because he believes that "when the trees are tall they will make a good face for the environment." 

He plans on using his income from the KOMAZA trees to pay school fees and to help buy food for his family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita has engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Emelita is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and lead weights. With these purchases, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus improving their fish sales in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Victory

texts.en:
Victory lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has no children. She has been doing farming work for two years. Her primary income sources are selling milk and her job's salary.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Grazing cows!" Her biggest challenge is "Weeding." One animal on the farm has been given the name of Cheseger. She will use the loan of 60,000 KES requested to construct a greenhouse.

Victory was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Good training."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. She answered, "The kind of loans it gives to farmers."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. Victory was asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" She replied that it would help her produce "more income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Victory owns a cow, poultry, and a bicycle but does not own  a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito netting, electricity and TV, but does not have solar power, running water, sewing machine, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Varder

texts.en:
Varder is 46-years-old and lives in Sisian town with her husband and daughter. Her daughter, Anna, is 21 years old and studies at the Armenian State Pedagogical University, named after Khachatur Abovyan, in the faculty of history and jurisprudence. 

Varder and her husband work hard to cover the family's basic costs and at the same time Anna's education costs. Unfortunately it is very difficult for them to save money for Anna's university tuition, so Varder has applied for this loan. 

With the help of the loan Varder will pay her daughter's university tuition. It is very important for Varder and her husband to give their daughter an opportunity to complete her education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria works hard to support her family. Candelaria is single and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Candelaria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Candelaria has been in this business for 40 years now.

In the future, Candelaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas se llama este luchador grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, donde gracias al esfuerzo y al grano de arena que cada una pone ayudando a las demás, ya están en el ciclo 12 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
La Sra. Graciela es la Directora General del grupo, ella es cantinera de una escuela, también vende ropas y es  ama de casa. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y ejemplar, que se esfuerza por su familia, no se cansa de buscar el bien para sus familiares. También quiere poder ayudar a sus compañeras y siempre las alienta a seguir trabajando.
Solicita este crédito para poder comprar prendas de todo tipo para poder seguir con sus ventas y ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes, ya que quiere seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
This fighter group, from the city of Encarnación, is called Mujeres Unidas [United Women].

Thanks to the effort and work that every one puts in to help each other they are now in the twelfth phase of the women's entrepreneur program. 

Graciela is the General Director for the group. She works at a school canteen, sells clothes and is a housewife. She is a very hard working and exemplary woman. 

She works hard for her family and never gets tired of trying for the best for them. She also wants to help her teammates and is always encouraging them to keep working. 

She is asking for this loan to buy all types of clothing in order to keep going with her sales and offering good variety to her clients. She wants to keep going with her work.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver. These are the sources of their income. 

Fe is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks for her store like noodles, canned goods, biscuits and snack foods and also fuel for the motorcycle. With this, they will be able to increase their daily earnings and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store like noodles, canned goods, biscuits and snack foods as well as fuel for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. Aba sells Kenkey (a traditional corn based dish that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been selling kenkey for some time now. Her husband is a mason. Aba uses her income to help her husband in paying the family's general expenses. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of corn, thus helping her prepare more of her tasty kenkey recipe. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to develop her kenkey business further.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of corn, thus helping her prepare more of her kenkey recipe.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 25 years old and is married to Kelvin who contributes to the family income. They have one child who is eight months. She has been running the dairy milk shop for about three years with an income of KES 27,000 a month.

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. and she wants to buy more milk and other dairy products to sell. She hopes to be a leading dairy distributor, buy a plot of land for a residential house and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more milk and other dairy products.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She sells Sabo (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from maize and groundnuts) in Akonoma (near Cape Coast) which she has done for some time now. 

Abena is a widow and has six children. Abena uses her income to support herself and her six children. Abena will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to make Sabo. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to develop her Sabo enterprise further.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make Sabo.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is a 27 year old posho mill owner in Voi, Kenya. He is a married man and he supports one in his family. He has been in this business for the last two years and has done great.

This marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD to purchase sacks of dry maize for grinding into maize flour for resale. 

He will use the anticipated profit to stock more bags of maize and open a larger store, which can accommodate hundreds of maize bags. He hopes to be a great businessman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of dry maize for grinding into maize flour.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a widow and has six children. She has received some schooling till form four of middle school. Aba sells bread and tea in Akonoma (near Cape Coast), which she has done for 24 years. As the only breadwinner in the family, Aba uses her income to support her six children. Aba will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of bread and tea. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to develop her food-selling business further.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of bread and tea

loans.name: Josielyn

texts.en:
Josielyn is 31 years old, married, and has three children in school. Her husband is a government employee in their municipality. With her determination to help her husband in a simple way, Josielyn engages herself in the selling of cooked foods near the school in their village.

Josielyn cooks menus and snack food that she sells to the students in the school. Josielyn wants the growth of her business. She always sees to it that her cooked food will be liked by her costumers. Josielyn is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy meat and ingredients for cooking meals. She believes that acquiring the loan and managing the business well will lead for the growth of the business.

loans.use: to buy meat and ingredients for cooking meals.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is married and for years has been married and five kids. Her husband is employed and he contributes to the family's basic needs. 

She has had a coconut store for two years. She started with the help of her husband from his earnings to help start the business. The income from this business now covers the household expenses as well as school fees.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy sacks of coconuts, which are the top-selling items in her business. This will enable her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and allow for the possibility of increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She sells Kenkey (a traditional corn based dish that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been selling kenkey for two years. As a widow having to provide for four children, Esi uses her income to support the entire family. 

Esi will use the loan to purchase more maize thereby allowing her to meet rising customer demands. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to enhance her business operations by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to purchase more maize thereby allowing her to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Фарход проживает в районе Зафаробод города Истаравшан. Ему 30 лет. В семье их пятеро человек. Он живет с женой и с детьми. У него трое детей, двое сыновей и одна дочь. Его дети маленькие.  
Фарход на протяжении пяти лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Сейчас у Фархода четыре дойной коровы и десять голов овец. Каждый день Фарход получает 10 литров молока, 5 литров он оставляет себе а оставшиеся 5 литров его жена продает. Кроме того он вместе с женой занимается растениеводством. У него при доме имеется небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. 
Фарход берет кредит для закупа скота и корма для них.
texts.en: Farhod lives in the Zafarobod area of Istaravshan. He is 30 years old, married, and has 3 small children, 2 sons and 1 daughter. For the past 5 years, he has been earning a living in the field of animal husbandry. He raises cattle at home. He now has 10 sheep and 4 cows that give 10 liters of milk per day. He keeps 5 liters for his family's use and his wife sells the remaining 5 liters. In addition, he and his wife grow vegetables on a small plot of land near their house. Farhod is now seeking a loan to purchase cattle and cattle feed.

loans.use: to buy calves, bulls, and cattle feed

loans.name: Christiner

texts.en:
Christiner is married and has four school-going children. She owns a house with piped water and without electricity. For the past eight years she has been selling vegetables to earn a living; her customers are people from her village.

With the loan of KES 10,000 that she is asking for she aspires to buy goods for sale and expand her business. Competitors are the common challenge she is encountering.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans and be self employed.

loans.use: to buy goods for sale and expand her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delia is 49 years old and has one children who is in school.

Delia has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Delia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Linda is an entrepreneur. She sells rice and dresses in Akonoma (near Cape Coast) which she has done for five years. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She is responsible for helping to support her husband cover their family's general expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy more rice. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her working capital and expand her enterprise further.

loans.use: to buy more rice.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 34 years old and is married to Danson who is employed and contributes to the family income. They have three children. She has been running her cosmetics shop for about two years with an income of approx KES 35,000 per month.

This is her first loan in KADET Ltd. and wants to use it to buy more beauty products and hair extensions for sale. She hopes to expand her business and open other bigger businesses.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and hair extensions for sale.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a single mother of four children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business  selling green bananas and has been in this business for ten years. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges includes seasonality, defaulters and thieves.  

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start going to other villages of Masaka for green bananas. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is married and has two children. Although she has received no formal education, Aya is an entrepreneur. Aya sells oranges in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been selling oranges since 2006. Her husband is unemployed. Since she is the only breadwinner, Aya uses her income to support the entire family. 

Aya will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity of oranges, thereby allowing her to meet rising customer demands. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aya plans to develop her food-selling business further.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of oranges, thereby allowing her to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a widow with three school-going children. For the last two years she has been selling dry fish and farm products to satisfy her customers who are people from her village.

She owns a house with electricity and her greatest monthly expense is food. For the loan of KES 50,000 that she is asking for she is intending to buy more fish and firewood for sale to enable her to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fish and firewood for sale.

loans.name: Junes

texts.en:
Junes lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has three children and has been doing this work for five years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her construct a dairy unit.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Farming!' Her biggest challenge is 'Animal diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Lelkina, tuyai, seroy.'

Junes was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'The interest rate is a bit lower when compared to other MFIs.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That it offers assets apart from loan in cash form.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Junes replied 'I will be in a position to pay school fees for my children.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Junes owns the following: 'cow, poultry, automobile' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling goods and commodities to the people in her place. 

Florencia is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soda, bread, noodles, soap and toiletries and others. With this, she will be able to cater and sell more to the people in her place. 

Florencia dreams of making her business a success and experiencing fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soda, bread, noodles, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Radhagobinda Self Help Group

texts.en:
Radhagobinda Self Help Group is a group consisting of nine members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Mrs. Sukanti, who was selected as their president. Sukanti is a 22-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children, who are schooling. The lady standing fourth from the right hand side is Sukanti. Her husband works as a labourer in a factory situated near to her village. 

Sukanti runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

Sukanti has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She sells kenkey and sabo (two traditional Ghanaian dishes made primarily from corn and groundnuts respectively) in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). 

Ekua has been selling kenkey for some time now.  As a widow having to provide for her two children, she is responsible for supporting the entire family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize and groundnuts, thereby allowing her to meet rising customer demands. 

Ekua hopes to use the new profits from her business to diversify her food operations further.

loans.use: to buy more maize and groundnuts, thereby allowing her to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Japhet's Group

texts.en: Japhet is a 35-year-old father of two. He is a farmer who makes chairs, tables, and doors for the local market and his wife farms cassava, maize, cowpeas, and kale on their land. The biggest challenge he faces in his work is a lack of materials to make his products, and when he can find timber it's often very expensive. He is excited to join KOMAZA because he is impressed that they want to change the lives in his community and as a young father, "joining KOMAZA is like harvesting for the future of my children's lives." He hopes to use the income from his KOMAZA trees to educate his family, have timber for his woodworking business, and to someday build his dream house for his family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a fish vendor from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business for several years now. Her husband is engaged in a tricycle transport business. Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell, and to pay for the school fees of her children. In the future, Jocelyn hopes of making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and to pay the school fees of her children

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is married with six children; all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 20 years, selling to all categories of people on both a retail and wholesale basis six days out of every week at the market. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more bales of used clothing.  Her major business challenges include transportation, ever-increasing prices of used clothes, and thieves. She is aspiring to start importing used clothes and also to build more rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is a 31-year-old man and a second-time borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, applying for UGX 2,000,000. He paid the first loan well and in a timely manner. He rents a single-roomed house with his wife and two young daughters in the outskirts of Kampala. Bashir and his family mainly depend on their coffee-selling business, however, the business is affected by unstable power supplies.

Bashir applied for UGX 2,000,000 to finish up building his simple residential house so that he can use the money he has been spending on the loan to pay back the loan. He hopes when it's complete, he can expand his business. He has got future plans of building a better house and boosting his business.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete his residential house

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of two children, ages 11 and 3. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Janita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, chips and biscuits, bread, soap and toiletries, cooking seasonings, and other items. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Janita hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, chips and biscuits, bread, soap and toiletries, cooking seasonings, and other items.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte sells rice in Akonoma (near Cape Coast), which she has been doing for 15 years. She has studied up to form four of middle school and is now married with 5 children. Her husband works as a carpenter. She uses the proceeds from her business to help her husband cover their family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more rice, therefore allowing her to meet increasing customers' demands. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further develop her food-selling enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more rice, allowing her to meet increasing customers' demands

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married and has six school-going children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. For the past nine years she has been selling dried fish and paraffin in a shop; her customers are people from her village.

With the loan of KSH 40,000, Luvuno wants to purchase products for her shop kiosk to enable her to expand her business and educate her children. She decided to join Yehu so that she can access loans and be self-employed.

loans.use: to purchase products for her shop kiosk

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is married and has six school-going children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water and her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the last three years she has had a kiosk and is currently going door-to-door selling woven mats. Mlongo's customers are people from her village.

For the loan of KSH 10,000, Mlongo intends to buy more materials for mat weaving so that she can expand her business and even rent a shop for selling her products.

She decided to join Yehu so that she can access loans that can help her boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for mat weaving

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the number of his sheep to increase his income

loans.name: Mulungu's Group

texts.en:
Mulungu is a 39-year-old farmer and father of five. His wife is also a farmer, and they plant maize, cowpeas and cassava on their land. 

Mulungu and his wife sometimes resort to making charcoal to sell in the markets when there has been a drought and their crops are not plentiful enough to feed their family. Mulungu is excited to work with KOMAZA because the trees will uplift his living standards, and KOMAZA provides short-term crops for him to grow as he waits for his trees to mature. 

Mulungu would like to use the income from his KOMAZA trees to open a savings account, as well as his own lumber shop.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has one child. Her husband is a teacher. Having successfully graduated from junior high school, Grace currently works as a cosmetics seller and seamstress in Akonoma (near Cape Coast), which she has been doing since 2008. Grace uses her income to help her husband in covering their family's general expenses. Grace will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to increase her working capital and further develop her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her fruits and vegetables stall business. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, and green vegetables for resale. She is grateful for the opportunity that Kiva lenders and Yehu Microfinance have given to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.ru:
Махлиё жительница города Истаравшан. Она замужем. Ей 44 года. Она живет вместе с двумя дочерьми. Муж Махлиё находится за рубежом. Махлиё одна растет детей и обеспечивает семью. 
Вот уже пять лет как Махлиё занимается животноводством. После отъезда мужа ей нужно было обеспечивать семью самой. Так как многие жители в городе занимаются животноводством, она решила заняться купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Этот вид бизнеса не так рискован как другие. Сейчас она разводит крупно - рогатый скот у себя дома. Махлиё зарабатывает путем разведения курупнорогатого скота. 
Махлиё берет кредит для закупа бычков, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота. Она благодарит всех, кто поддержит ее, так как этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Mahliyo is a resident of Istaravshan.  She is married.  She is 44 years old.  She lives with her two daughters.  Mahliyo's husband is abroad.  Mahliyo raises the children alone and provides for the family.

For five years now Mahliyo has been raising livestock.  After her husband left she needed to provide for her family.  Because many residents of the city raise livestock she decided to buy and sell cattle.  This business is not as risky as others.  Now she raises cattle at her home.  Mahliyo earns money by raising cattle.

Mahliyo is taking out a loan for the purchase of calfs in order to increase her livestock headcount.  She is thanking everyone who supports her as this business is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy calfs in order to increase livestock headcount, as this business is her only source of income

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She sells kenkey (a traditional corn-based dish that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been selling kenkey for three years. 

As a single mother having to raise four children, Ekua is responsible for supporting the entire family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize, henceforth allowing her to produce more kenkey to sell. 

Ekua hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her kenkey enterprise further.

loans.use: to buy more maize, henceforth allowing her to produce more kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is from Vanadzor town and lives with her daughter (pictured right in the photo) and mother, who is a pensioner. 

Narine's daughter, Naira, studies at Armenian State University of Economics in the department of marketing and business organization. As the family's main breadwinner, Narine works hard to sustain her family's living and at the same time cover her daughter's education costs. 

Narine has applied for this loan to pay for Naira's university tuition. The loan is very important for Narine to give her daughter an opportunity to complete her education. She dreams of seeing her daughter working as a good specialist and is very proud of having such a daughter.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie earns a living through her food vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her community. 

Julie is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients, such as flour, sugar, milk and margarine. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more, which will help improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, such as flour, sugar, milk and margarine for her food vending business.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Adwowa is an entrepreneur, selling saucepans in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). Adwowa has been selling saucepans since 2003. 

She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Adwowa is responsible for helping her husband in covering the family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of saucepans to meet rising customers’ demands. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her working capital, and ensure all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of saucepans to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 34-year-old married woman, and a mother of four children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. 

Mary Jane and her husband have been operating a fishing business together for more than five years. This is their source of income. Mary Jane is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and floaters. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, which will give them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and floaters to help improve their fishing catch.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a widow and has two children. She has received no formal education. 

Abena sells beans and plantains in Nkontrodo, near Elmina, which she has done for the past twenty years. Abena uses her income to support herself and her children and save for their futures. Abena will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity of beans and plantains to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to increase her working capital and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of beans and plantains to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has five children. She has received no formal education. Aba sells the traditional mashed corn dough, known as fante kenkey, in Eguafo near Elmina. She has been selling her popular meal for some time now. Her husband is a farmer in their community. 

Aba uses her income to help support her husband with their family's general expenses. Aba will use the loan to purchase more maize and banana leaves to prepare her fante kenkey to sell With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to grow her fante kenkey trade.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and banana leaves to prepare fante kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a widow and has three children. She is responsible for paying to support herself and her children and saving for their futures. She has received no formal education. 

Abena sells shea butter and soap in Eguafo, near Elmina. She has been in this business for some time now. Her loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of lotions and soaps to sell in her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her lotion and soap selling business further.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of lotions and soaps to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sarrah Jean

texts.en: Sarrah Jean is a 31-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. Sarrah Jean has been engaged in "talaba" or oyster farming for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Sarrah Jean is asking for a loan to buy more materials, like bamboo, netting, rope and straw, for talaba farming. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her oyster farm, thus increasing her profit and income.

loans.use: to buy more materials, like bamboo, netting, rope and straw, for talaba farming

loans.name: Ekow

texts.en:
Ekow is single. He has received schooling through junior high school. Ekow sells books and stationary in Nkontrodo, near Elmina, which he has done for three years. Ekow uses his income to support himself and pay all his own expenses. 

Ekow will use the loan to purchase more books and stationary to sell in his shop. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ekow plans to increase his working capital and save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more books and stationary to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Wambui

texts.en:
Wambui is 51 years old, married and the mother of three children. For the past 33 years, she has earned a living by selling clothes. She earns a monthly profit of KES 12,710. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of KES 20,000, to buy additional stocks of items, such as dresses, blouses, trousers and shirts, to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her last born child, as well as to continue expanding her business. 

Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional dresses, blouses, trousers and shirts for resale.

loans.name: Vengie

texts.en: Vengie is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of two children, ages 8 and 4 years old. Vengie is also engaged in a motorcycle transport business. These are the sources of his income. Vengie is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the motorcycle and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, he will be able to improve his business as well as his earnings. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fuel for his motorcycle and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe has three children. At her age of 49, she is already a widow. Fe is running a vegetable vending business in the market. Through her business, she is able to send her children in school and finish their education. 

Fe’s goal in life is to have earnings for whatever emergency will happen to her. She has savings to get. Fe wants to gain higher income than her usual income from the business. She plans to sell additional various vegetables in her stall. Fe is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy bitter gourd, eggplant, tomatoes, and string beans. She hopes to achieve her goal in life and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy bitter gourd, eggplant, tomatoes, and string beans.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 30 years old, and is married to Esther, who contributes to the family income. He has been running his retail shop for the last two years with an income of KES 20,000 a month.

He has applied for his first business loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD to buy more stock of maize, wheat flour, soap and detergents to sell in his shop. 

In the future, he hopes to be a wholesaler and give his children quality education.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize, wheat flour, soap and detergents to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine (on the right) is a 39-year-old mother of three children. Marine and her husband Gagik (pictured on the left) work hard to sustain their family. 

There is a high unemployment rate in their city, but Gagik's work at a local clinic as a dentist helps the family have some stable income. Unfortunately, that income is hardly enough to cover the family's daily costs.

Marine's elder daughter Elen (pictured) studies pharmacy at Vanadzor State College. The family's income is not enough to cover Elen's education costs, so Marine has applied for this loan. With the loan's help she will pay for Elen's university tuition. The loan is very important for Elen to complete her education, with which she hopes to become a good specialist and help her parents to sustain their family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter Elen's university tuition.

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en: Nana Ekua is a widow and has one child. She has received no formal education. Nana Ekua sells kenkey in Nkontrodo near Elmina. She has been selling her kenkey recipe for the past 30 years. Nana Ekua uses her income to support herself and her child and save for their future. Nana Ekua will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare her kenkey recipe. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana Ekua plans to expand her kenkey trade further.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to prepare her kenkey recipe.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 43 years old and married to Festus who contributes to the family income. She has been running her grocery store for a period of about three years, with an income of KES 30,000 a month.

This is her first loan in KADET LTD and she wants to buy more green vegetables for resale and also repair the store's structure. 

Harriet hopes to educate her children to a higher level and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy more green vegetables for resale and materials to improve the store's structure.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba sells smoked fish near Elmina. Araba has received no formal education. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Araba has been selling smoked fish for two years . She is responsible for helping to support her husband in paying their family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase more fish to prepare and sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her fish trade.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to prepare and sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy curtains, bed covers and clothing material to sell.
