loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells fante kenkey near Elmina. Ama has received schooling through a middle school level.  She is a widow and has three children. 

Ama has been selling fante kenkey for three years. She is responsible for paying to support herself and her children and saving for their futures. Her loan will be used to buy more maize and banana leaves to prepare her kenkey recipe. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her business further.

loans.use: to buy more maize and banana leaves to prepare her kenkey recipe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy irrigation equipment for her farm, to ensure a steady water supply.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 37 years old, married and the father of four children. For the past three years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of KES 8,660. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his second loan, in the amount of KES 30,000.

Michael is going to use the loan to service and repair his motorbike. He will use the profits to pay his childrens' school fees, as well as continue growing his businesses. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses, so that he can improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to service and repair his motorbike, which he uses to transport passengers.

loans.name: Kinyua

texts.en:
Kinyua is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya, where he lives with his wife and two children, ages 6 and 2 years old. He has been in farming for ten years and currently produces mainly milk and tea for the local market. His family upkeep fully relies on farming income.

Kinyua has made a loan request of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He wants diversify his farming business and believes poultry farming will enable him have gainful returns and educate his children.

He notes that poor rains are currently leading to crop failure.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
En su ciclo 12 está este grupo llamado Renacer, todas ellas son muy trabajadoras, y se fijaron como meta poder crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas. Son mujeres jefas de familia que día a día quieren salir adelante. Todas ellas participan activamente en las reuniones quincenales, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del comité, es un excelente grupo.
Susana, una de ellas, vende productos de limpieza, cuenta que sus ventas están mejorando y gracias a esto esta teniendo los medios para salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de microfranquicia de limpieza, que les ofrece la fundación paraguaya, para que con ello siga haciendo sus productos de limpieza y venderlos para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This group, called Renacer (Rebirth), is in its 12th cycle. All are hard-working members, and their goal was to grow, not only economically, but in number of people as well. They are women who are heads of their households and day by day try to get buy. They are all active participants in the bi-monthly meetings, and they help one another in order to reach their common objectives. It is an excellent group.

Susana is a member of this group who sells cleaning supplies. She states that sales are increasing and that, thanks to this, she has the means to get by and help her family. She is asking for a loan in order to buy a cleaning micro-franchise, which is being offered by the Paraguayan Foundation, in order to continue making her own cleaning products to sell and continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy a cleaning micro-franchise.

loans.name: Saul Orlando

texts.es:
Saúl, se dedica a  la agricultura y ganadería en pequeño. Él vive solo y no tiene familiares en el extranjero, inicio  este negocio como una fuente de ingresos para su sustento. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá invertir en la compra de insumos como abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla, para una pequeña parcela de tierra. Este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar en la productividad y sus ingresos. Su objetivo es adquirir un espacio propio para la siembra, ya que trabaja en terreno alquilado.
texts.en:
Saúl makes a living in small-scale agriculture and livestock. He lives alone and has no family abroad. He started this business as a source of income to support himself.

He is requesting the loan to invest in buying supplies such as compost, fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide and seeds, for a small plot of land. This loan will help him to increase productivity and his earnings. His aim is to buy his own land to farm, as he currently works on rented land.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide and seeds.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.en:
Basilio is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya where he lives with wife and two children, aged seven and two years. He has been in farming for twenty years, and currently mainly produces cereal, such as maize, beans and vegetables for the local market. He meets all his family's basic needs through his farming business.

Basilio has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and says that he will use the loan to buy irrigation pipes and a water tank. He says that the availability of water will improve his farming income and enable him to educate his children.

He mentions the lack of capital, and pests and diseases as the main farming challenges.

loans.use: to buy irrigation equipment for his farming business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 59-year-old widow. She has two children aged 25 and 30. She describes herself to be social woman. 

She operates a retail business where she sells items such as sweets, biscuits, water, and soda etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a highly populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. 

Fatuma describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to to buy biscuits, sweets, and ground nuts to sell. Her goal is to enlarge her business within five years. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay a previous loan of Kes 60,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sweets, and ground nuts to sell in her retail business.

loans.name: Jose Geronimo

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de comprar ganado de repasto, para así aumentar los ingresos  en su negocio, su interes es por dos vacas con crias. 
Con el crédito anterior logro adquirir una vaca lechera, para el sustento de la familia y seguir trabajando en el cultivo. Él ha podido mantener y seguir trabajando en su actividad.
texts.en: José is requesting a new loan to buy cattle, in order to increase the profits of his business. He wants to buy two grazing cows in calf. With his previous loan he managed to buy a milk cow, to support his family and continue working as a farmer. He has been able to maintain and keep working in his activities.

loans.use: to buy two cows in calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is 36 years old, married to James and a mother of six children. She plants and sells vegetables in bulk, and has been in this business for four years. She gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be her third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to pay her childrens' school fees with part of the loan and also buy assorted vegetable seedlings. 

In future she wants to educate her children and be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for her business and pay her childrens' school fees.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. He resides in his rural home with his family of three children, and carries out mixed farming, with fruit and vegetables being his main produce for the local market.

Justin has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He says that the diversification will help him have a more consistent income, despite fluctuations in climatic conditions which mainly affects crops in the area. He points out that poor rains and animal diseases are the main challenges in his farming business.

In the photo, Justin is pictured next to a dairy unit, although he is requesting funding for poultry.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds, which will enable him to diversify his farming business.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.en:
Maria Lucia is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is from Getafe, Bohol. 

Maria Lucia has been engaged in a tricycle transport business together with her husband for more than three years now. This is the source of their income. 

Maria Lucia plans to buy spare parts for the tricycle, like wheels, tires, nuts and bolts, and to pay for the repair. 

In the future, Maria Lucia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the tricycle, like wheels, tires, nuts and bolts, and to pay for the repair.

loans.name: Aalaa

texts.en:
Aalaa is a 25-year-old single man, who has been working as a car mechanic and electrician for ten years. Aalaa was only fifteen years old when he started working to make his own living, and to provide his family with an additional income.

In 2010, Aalaa opened his own maintenance shop, to increase his income and improve his living. His business is developing well, because of his good reputation and long experience. 

Aalaa is planning to make a small family of his own, but he can't afford to pay his wedding fees from his business, because he has already used some of his business capital for his house and its improvements. That is why he is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his wedding fees, and to keeping his business capable of supporting itself in a well managed way.

He wants to keep on developing his business as much as he can, to be sure that none of his future children will face what he faced during his childhood. He will make sure that they will get the best education ever, which has always been a dream for him.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding fees.

loans.name: Glenda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Glenda, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de comprar materia prima para el negocio tales como: maíz, harina, aceite entre otros y para reparar la plancha de cocina. 
Con el crédito anterior le permitió llenar las  expectativas, ya que la compra le ayudo a aumentar la clientela. Los ingresos económicos han mejorado y también logro remodelar parte de su vivienda.
texts.en: Glenda is requesting a new loan to buy raw materials for her business, such as corn, flour, and oil, and to repair her kitchen grill. Her previous loan allowed her to achieve her goals, as the ingredients she bought helped her to attract more customers. Her earnings have increased and she also managed to refurbish part of her home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business such as corn, flour, and oil, and to repair her kitchen grill.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a mother of three children, all of school going age. She lives with her family in their rural home, where she has been carrying out farming for fifteen successive years, and producing tea, bananas, maize and beans for the local market and family upkeep.

Stellah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her set up a greenhouse. She says this will improve her farming production, which has always been limited by her small parcel of land available for farming. She plans to save any gains made in her farming business, to enable her buy more parcels of land in the future.

She mentions pests and diseases as the major challenges in farming. She appreciate the impact Juhudi Kilimo has made on smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse which will help her improve her farming production.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
La señora Victorina, es de la Ciudad de Santaní, es casada, con hijos, su marido trabaja en un aserradero. La señora realiza trabajo de recepción para fiestas, alquila sillas, mesas y cubiertos en general para todos tipos de acontecimientos, abarca todos los barrios de Santaní y comunidades cercana a la ciudad.
Es una señora luchadora, trabajadora, honesta y muy responsable, empezó a trabajar como empleada domestica por la ciudad de Santaní, su sueño de siempre era de trabajar en forma independiente de tener su propio negocio y no depender de otra persona, con la plata que ella ganaba y con la ayuda de su marido empezó a comprar sillas, mesas, manteles y cubiertos. Desde aquel entonces comenzó con su nuevo trabajo con mucha fuerza y voluntad para salir adelante, consiguió muchos trabajos gracias al buen servicio que ofrece  a cada uno de sus clientes eso le facilita realizar el servicio de manera eficiente. Al correr de los años compro más sillas mesas y todos lo que necesita en su trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de manteles, sillas y mesas, para poder ampliar su servicio y seguir con el buen trabajo que viene haciendo. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Victorina is from Santaní city and married with children. Her husband works at a sawmill. She makes a living at party receptions. She generally rents chairs, tables, and silverware for all types of occasions, covering all of the neighborhoods of Santaní and communities close to the city.

She is determined, hard-working, honest, and very responsible. She began working as an domestic worker for Santaní city. Her dream has always been to work independently, own her own business, and not rely on other people. 

With the money she was earning, and with the help from her husband, she started to buy seats, tables, tablecloths, and silverware. From that point on, she started her job with a lot of effort and willpower to get ahead. She got many jobs thanks to the good service she offers to each one of her customers. That allows her to provide her service efficiently. Over the years, she bought more chairs, tables, and everything she needed for her work.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of tablecloths, chairs, and tables, so that she can enlarge her service, and continue with the good work that comes with doing it.

She is thankful for the help she is receiving. For her, it is very useful.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths, seats, and tables to rent out.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la crianza de pollos y a la ganadería. Ella está casada, tiene tres hijos y sus edades son de 20, 22, 24 años, todos estudian y dependen de ella; no tiene familiares en el extranjero. 
María, realiza su trabajo de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm, este oficio lo heredo de sus padres hace diez año; la ventaja  que la respalda, es que tiene terreno propio con pasto para el ganado y al igual cuenta con espacio para la granja. El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de maicillo, concentrado para los pollos  y para el ganado.
Esta inversión le ayudara en su negocio, ya que le permitirá incrementar la producción de pollos para luego venderlos y aumentar en el ganado. Los riesgos que pueden suceder es enfermedad en los pollos  y el costo del concentrado para las reses.
texts.en:
María makes a living raising chickens and cattle. She is married and has three children aged 20, 22, and 24. They all study and are dependent on her, as they have no family living abroad. María works from 6:00am to 4:00pm, and inherited her work from her parents ten years ago. The advantage of this is that she has her own land with grass for the cattle and space for a farm. 

She needs the loan to buy sorghum and feed for her chicken and cattle. This loan will help her with her business, as it will enable her to increase the productivity of her chickens to then sell them on and buy cattle. The risks she faces are any illnesses her chickens may suffer and the high cost of cattle feed.

loans.use: to buy sorghum and feed for their chickens and cattle.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu is 28 years old, married and the mother of four children.  For the past twelve years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her general store in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES. 24,000.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES. 25,000.   She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her shop such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour to sell to her customers. 

Zenabu will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children, as well as expand her business. Her future goal is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Гулчехра жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое сыновей. Гулчехра добрая, отзывчивая и ответственная женщина. Она на протяжении четырех лет занимается животноводством. В основном Гулчехра занимается купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. В этом ей помогают ее сыновья. Гулчехра также занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает овощи на грядке. На сегодняшний день у Гулчехры две дойной коровы. Ее семья обеспечена молочными продуктами, кроме того Гулчехра каждый день продает свежее молоко. 
Гулчехра берет кредит для закупа телят. Она хочет увеличить поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a resident of the city of Istaravshan. She is 48 years old. She is married and has two sons. 

Gulchehra is a good, sympathetic and responsible woman. She has been working with livestock breeding for a period of four years. Gulchehra mainly works with buying and reselling cattle. Her sons help her with this. Gulchehra also works with field crop cultivation. She grows vegetables in the garden. Currently Gulchehra has two dairy cows. Her family is provided with dairy products, and in addition to this Gulchehra sells fresh milk every day. 

Gulchehra takes a loan to purchase two calves. She hopes to increase the number of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase calves with an aim to increase the number of cattle, as she currently only has two cows

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 45 лет. Он живет с женой. У него двое детей, дочь и сын. Хасан вместе со своей семьей занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Его дети ведут скот на пастбища в теплое время года. Животноводством Хасан занимается десять лет. Он берет кредит для закупа двух коров, чтобы обеспечить семью молоком и молочными продуктами.
texts.en:
Hasan lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is 45 years old. He lives with his wife. He has two children, a daughter and a son. 

Hasan works with livestock breeding together with his wife. He breeds livestock at his home. His children lead the livestock to the grazing in the warmer time of year. Hasan has been working with livestock breeding for 10 years. 

Hasan takes a loan for the purchase of two cows, in order to provide his family with milk and dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase two cows, in order to provide his family with milk and dairy products

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El sr Edgar  es un hombre de 25 años,  es padre de familia de  dos hijos y uno que viene en camino. El es taxista desde hace 9 años y gracias a esta profesión ha podido sustentar a su familia. El necesita ayuda por medio de kiva para poder arreglar su taxi, ya que necesita unos ajustes al motor para que pueda funcionar en perfectas condiciones.  Para él lo más importante en su vida, es su familia y siempre busca superarse para darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
Edgar is a 25 year-old man. He is the father in the family, with two children, and one on the way. He has been a taxi driver for 9 years. Thanks to his profession, he has been able to sustain his family. 

He needs Kiva's help to be able to repair his taxi, since it needs motor adjustments in order to run in perfect condition. 

For him, the most important thing in his life is his family. He is always trying to outdo himself to give them the best.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer in her rural home in Nkubu, where she lives with her husband and four children. She has been farming for seven years, producing mainly maize and beans for the local market. She gets additional income in the local market from her secondhand clothing retail business. 

Esther has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds, so she can diversify her farming business. She believes the poultry business will cushion the poor performance of crops due to inadequate rains and pests, and will help her educate her children.

She says she chose Juhudi Kilimo for the loan facility due to her belief it renders the best services.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds to start a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman and a mother of six children from Talibon, Bohol. Imelda is engaged in retail business selling seafood products. 

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy additional seafood like oysters, shrimp, sea cucumber. With this, she will be able to sell more and increase her income. In the future, Imelda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional seafood like oysters, shrimp, and sea cucumber

loans.name: Maria Diodora

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir creciendo en su negocio y este le permitirá mejores utilidades en su actividad. Con dicho préstamo podrá comprar hilo, pita, para seguir su oficio.
Con el  crédito anterior le ayudo a crecer, ya que hoy cuenta con una pequeña tienda, lo cual le ha sido de mucho beneficio. Si le ha cambiado su circunstancias, porque ha generado más ingresos y con ello ha aportado a su familia.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan because she needs to keep helping her business grow. It would allow her  to make useful improvements in her business activity. With this loan, she could buy string and twine to continue with her craft work.

The previous loan helped her business grow, and now she has a small shop, which has been of great benefit to her. It has changed her circumstances, because she has been able to generate more income and thus support her family

loans.use: to buy thread and twine to continue with her craft work.

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru:
Анварчон проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Анварчон занимается растениеводством. В этом ему помогает семья. У него имеется 1,2 га орошаемой земли. Сейчас он подготовил эту землю для посадки семян лука. Также на данный момент у Анварчона есть ещё дополнительный доход от того, что у него имеется дойная корова.  
Анварчон берет кредит для закупа семян лука.
texts.en:
Anvarjon lives in the city of Khujand. He is 30 years old. He is married, and has two children. 

Anvarjon works with field crop cultivation. His family helps him with this. He has 1.2 hectares of irrigated land. Currently he prepares this land for sowing seeds for onions. Further, currently Anvarjon has an additional income from having one dairy cow. 

Anvarjon takes a loan to purchase seeds for onions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds in order to plant onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, rice flour, fuel, pork cracklings, [Salvadorean soft] cheese, drinks, and beans among other things.

loans.name: Edgardo Antonio

texts.es:
Edgardo, tiene venta de productos básicos. Está casado y tiene un hijo, ellos dependen de él. Edgardo inicio el negocio por la necesidad de mejorar su situación económica  y así llevar el sustento a su familia.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su negocio, arroz, frijoles, azucar, este le ayudara para aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Su objetivo es expandir su tienda e incrementar su clientela.
texts.en:
Edgardo sells basic goods. He is married and has a child. They are dependent on him. Edgardo set up his business because of the need to improve his economic situation and support his family.

He will invest the loan in buying more merchandize for his business, such as rice, sugar and beans. This will help him to increase profits and through this, improve his family's living conditions. His goal is to expand his business and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy more merchandize, such as rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, 57 years old, is from Migori. He is married to Loicy who is a housewife, and they are blessed with seven children between the ages of 8 and 24.

He operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been doing this for 10 years, and he makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase some spare parts and repair his motorbike. 

He will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business. He dreams of buying another motorbike for his business so as to earn more income to help support his family.

loans.use: To buy spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Rose, a 40-year-old married mother of two, describes herself as an ambitious woman. Rose has been operating a food stall where she sells fish for the last 11 years. Her enterprise is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be an inadequate supply of fish to sell.

Rose will use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy more fish, her business goal being to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 24 years old and is married to a businessman. She sells bed sheets. She wants the loan to buy more bed sheets for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets for sale.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es: Martín, tiene la edad  de 58 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  materiales para poder hacer la construcción de un local donde pueda tener y desarrollar algunos cerdos para el engorde.  La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene y las buenas condiciones para ubicar un chiquero  para los cerdos. Además de obtener unos cerdos de buena calidad que a corto plazo puedan estar gordos y de buena calidad. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar la actividad, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en el proyecto y a la vez darle más ingresos económicos a su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Martín is 58 years old, married, and lives with his children and wife, who are his top priority. With this loan, he plans to buy materials to construct a building in which he can raise some fattening pigs. The idea is to make use of the space and good conditions he has to build a pigsty. He also wants to buy some high quality pigs that he can fatten in a short space of time. This purchase will enable him to develop his activities and also save money, which will allow him to buy more animals and invest more in his project. It will also bring in more money for his family. 

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan more easily and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora,  solicita un nuevo crédito por la necesidad de invertir más en su negocio, ya que el anterior fue de mucha utilidad. Este le permitirá comprar maíz, frijol, chicharrón, queso entre otros.
Con el préstamo antiguo  mejoro su negocio, aumento la clientela y asi posteriormente incrementaron sus ingresos. Las condiciones familiares se han optimizado porque las entradas de dinero fueron mayores.
texts.en:
Dora is requesting a new loan because she needs to invest more in her business.  This is because the previous loan was very useful.  This will allow her to buy corn, beans, pork, and cheese, among others.

With the old loan she improved her business, increased her clientele, and later increased her income.  Her family situation has been enhanced because of increased income.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, pork, and cheese, among others.

loans.name: Lienel

texts.en:
Lienel is a 25-year-old married man and father of a 1-year-old child. Lienel is a fisherman and has been in the fishing business for several years now.

Lienel is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, and to purchase materials for house repair like cement, wood, nails and others. With the loan, he will be able to improve his business and augment his income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, and to pay for house repair materials like cement, wood, nails and others.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 44 years old, married and a mother of four children. For the last twelve years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of KES 17,000 from the business. 

Alice was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her second loan of KES 35,000, to buy additional stock of tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as to expand the business.

Alice's goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she may uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, and onions

loans.name: Gladys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gladys,  se dedica a la agricultura. Ella está casada, no tiene hijos y recibe ayuda del extranjero. Ella inicio su negocio como una fuente extra de ingresos para su hogar, este oficio lo aprendió con su familia. El préstamo que Gladys requiere lo invertirá en el cultivo de regadillo y en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, insecticidas.
Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la cosecha y con ello aumentar sus ganancias. Su objetivo es agrandar la producción, sembrar hortalizas y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Gladys is a farmer.  She is married, does not have children, and receives help from abroad.

She started her business as a source of extra income for her household.  She learned this trade with her family.

Gladys will use the loan that she needs for crop irrigation.  She will also buy manure, fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides.

This investment will help her to improve the harvest and increase her income.  Her objective is to have greater production, to plant vegetables, and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for irrigating the crops and to buy manure, fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Al Sadek Group

texts.en:
Zeinab is the featured borrower of Al Sadek's group. She got together with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Zeinab is a 54-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She has been working as a tailor for 17 years in order to help her husband in making a living and covering their expenses.

Zeinab is applying for this loan from Kiva's Partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary fabrics, threads and scissors. This loan will help her a lot in expanding her business and increasing her income. She is specializes in making curtains and couches covers, in addition to clothes-making.

Zeinab's customers trust her talents and recommend her to others. She is the one at the left in the picture.

Siham is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of one child. She has been working in agriculture for 15 years and is applying for this loan to buy a bedroom to make sure that she is satisfying her family's needs and making sure they have a healthy living space. She is the one pictured on the right.

Kahla is a 39-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She has been working in agriculture for 20 years to support her family's living. Through this loan, she will be able to make new curtains for her house and ensure that her family will be happy having a beautiful and healthy house in which to live.

loans.use: to buy necessary fabrics, threads and scissors

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en: Antoine is 27 years old and single. He sells spare parts for both bicycles and motorbikes. He wants the loan to buy more tires for sale. With the profits, he wants to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Kongba Chanam Leikai Group

texts.en:
“Growing up only with the support of elderly parents is tough,” says Rani. She is featured with the raised hand and belongs to Kongba Chanam Leikai SHG. Her elderly parents’ inability to earn good income for the family left all four siblings with only a primary school education. Rani started earning by weaving at an early age and supports the family. She also says she makes extra efforts to succeed because she doesn’t have what it takes.

During the initial stages of her business, Rani took loan credits from local money lenders to buy yarn and weaving materials. She used to weave only women’s wrap-around skirts. But with the small profits she made, she hardly managed to pay back the high-interest money lenders. 

Rani also started collecting woven products from other weavers in the locality, along with her own woven cloth, and sold them at a little higher rate at the main market. Rani continues her weaving business in this manner, and now she is acknowledged to be one of the successful unmarried females in the neighborhood. 

Rani joined a monthly savings group with the local money investment group, and she will get her savings at the end of every 12 months. Rani also says, “God helps those who help themselves,” because more than five weavers are working under her supervision now, and she hopes to do better in the future.

With this loan, Rani will purchase a lot of yarn and weave plenty of woven products. She wishes to get an extra loom in a couple of months if things go according to her plan. Rani hopes to expand her weaving business and provide a better life for her parents and family. She thanked WSDS and Kiva for the support and wish them blessings.

The rest of the group members are also engaged in weaving and embroidery works.

loans.use: to buy products to expand her weaving business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has a tailoring shop in Kangundo town.She is 35 years old and married to Boniface who is a businessman. They have two children. She makes dresses, blouses, shirts and school uniforms to sell. She also sells sewing materials to other tailors.

She has been in this business for the past five years and it has been profitable. This being her fourth loan term, she plans to buy more sewing materials, threads and needles.

She hopes to grow her business by opening another tailoring business. This will allow her to make more income and be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more material for sewing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy detergents to sell

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en: Fidele is 34 years old. He is married with two children who are 4 and 8 years old. He sells different types of clothes for women, men and even youth. He has been in the business for eight years. With the loan, he wants to add more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Salim

texts.ru: Салим дехканин, выращивает картофель на своей земле в селе. Ему 28 лет, женат, имеет  одного ребёнка. Также они имеют домашний скот, так как живут в сельском районе. По профессии он мастер строитель. Жена помогает при работе на земле. От выращивания картофеля каждый год  они получают стабильный хороший доход и он хочет  увеличить объём урожая картофеля и получить доход. Полученный доход поможет сделать некоторые расходы для своей семьи. Салим обратился за кредитом в Арванд.
texts.en: Salim is a farmer that grows potatoes on his land in a village.  He is twenty eight years old, married, and has one child.  The family also has some livestock since they live in a rural area.  By profession, he is a master builder.  His wife helps him with his farming duties.  They family receives a stable income each year from their harvest and Salim now wants to increase the size of his potato crop in order to increase the size of his income.  The additional income will help his family with the cost of living.  Salim has turned to Arvand for a loan.

loans.use: to grow potatoes

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 40 years of age, married and has three children. She does quarry business in Makueni town where she sells stone building blocks to construction sites. She has been in this business for three years and it has been profitable.

This will be her third loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy quarry tools and equipment. These include a wheelbarrow, mattocks, and spades, as well as a safety kit. This will enable her to increase her production and hence, generate more income with which she will pay school fees for her children.

Jackline hopes to expand her business by buying more pieces of land for quarrying so she can make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase quarry tools for mining.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoe.

loans.name: Evaste

texts.en: Evaste is 40 years old. She is married to a driver. They both have five children and they all go to school. She sells various items including charcoal and foodstuffs. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal, potatoes and bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, potatoes and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Lona Seluwa

texts.en: lona benefited from previous loans as follows: she has paid part of her children's fees, increased her working capital, and now is taking a new loan to buy more beans, onions, etc. She is happy for the loans.

loans.use: to buy more items like onions, cowpeas, and beans.

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин  молодой парень в возрасте 26 лет , женат имеет 1 ребёнка. Он дома с своей женой занимаются откармливанием скота а также куплей продажей. От этого они получают хороший доход для проживание и расходов семьи. Сам Камолиддин также пастух и он ухаживает за скотом своих друзей и знакомых и также от этого он получает деньги. Но стабильный хороший доход он получает от купли продажи скота и поэтому он хочет получить кредит.
texts.en: Kamoliddin is a young man, age 26.  He's married and has one child.  Together with his wife, they purchase, fatten and sell cattle on their land.  They receive a good income from this and provide for their family.  Kamoliddin is a shepherd and he cares for the livestock of his friends and acquaintances.  He receives payment for these services.  However, it is the purchase and sale of cattle that provides a good, stable income, therefore, he wants to take out a loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina, administra una tienda y molino. Está casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales no depende de ella, tienen 26 y 30 años de edad; no recibe ayuda del extranjero.
Ella inicio su negocio como una fuente de ingresos para su familia, lo realiza en los horarios de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda como lo son churros, sodas, jabón, queso, entre otros productos. Esto le permitirá mejorar el inventario de su tienda, para así ofrecer diversidad de mercadería a su clientela.
Su objetivo  es mejorar su casa, adquirir un molino extra para optimizar la actividad de moler maiz.
texts.en:
Reina runs a store and mill.  She is married and has two children.  They are 26 and 30 years old and not dependent upon her.  She does not receive help from abroad.

She started her business as a source of income for her family.  She works on a schedule from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her store.  She will buy things like churros, sodas, soap, and cheese, among other products.  This will allow her to improve the inventory in her store so that she can offer her clientele a diversity of merchandise.

Her objective is to improve her house and to get an extra mill in order to optimize her business activity of grinding corn.

loans.use: to buy churros, sodas, soap, and cheese, among other products.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 25 years old and married. She operates a tailoring shop and has been in the business for the past two years. She earns a monthly profit of 6,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and she is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES. Loice intends to use the loan to add some clothing material for her business. She will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees of her niece, as well as continue expanding her income generating activities. 

In the future, Loice hopes to grow her tailoring shop as she intends to open up a well established boutique in the area.

loans.use: to add some clothing material for making dresses.

loans.name: Ma. Helen

texts.en: Ma. Helen is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of 10-year-old son. She has been engaged in a fishing business for than ten years now with her husband. Ma. Helen is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and an engine for the boat. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and an engine for the boat.

loans.name: Domitille

texts.en: Domitille is 38 years old. She sells different types of fabrics. With the loan, she wants to buy more fabric for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 45 years old and married with three children. She is a cash crop farmer and plants maize, beans, bananas and vegetables to sell. She has been in this farming business for three years. Besides this, she also has a shoe vending shop.

This being her first loan term, she plans to use the amount to buy farming supplies. These include fertilizer and seeds for planting. She also plans to buy more stock of shoes to sell in her shoe vending business.

In the future, Susan hopes to grow her farming business by practicing large scale farming, hence make more income and be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 33 years old. She is married to a driver. She sells spare parts for vehicles. With the loan, she will buy more spare parts for resale. The profits from the business will be used for savings. She is aiming higher in the future to become a sole distributor of the spare parts in the region. She is very happy with the previous loan, which helped in increasing the volume of her sales.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for cars and motobikes for resale.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. Majida has been working in the food business since three years ago.

She works in making and preparing Mouneh (traditional way of conserving nonseasonal food). She also works as a detergents selling company representative to increase her income and expand her working area.

Majida is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary products to prepare for her high season business, such as vine leaves, Labneh, and a lot of traditional conserved food, in parallel with home made jam.

This is Majida's first cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, she hopes that the future relationship with Al Majmoua will be invested in expanding her working zone more and more.

loans.use: to buy necessary products to prepare for her high season business

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is a fisherman living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and has three young children. Noel is asking for a loan to buy fuel for his fishing boat. With this loan, he will be able to continue in his fishing business, thus increasing his income and profit.

loans.use: to buy fuel for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Kashutu

texts.en:
Kashutu is a widow, aged 56 years. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges. 

Kashutu is requesting for Kshs 50,000 to expand her kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Changawa

texts.en: Changawa is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as a social woman. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock of charcoal to sell. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to run a retail shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 45 years old. She is married with five children between the ages of 9 and 20 years old, They all attend school. Alphonsine sells food stuffs and has spent seven years in the business. With the loan, she will add more foodstuffs for sale, such as potatoes and bananas, as well as charcoal. The profits will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, bananas, and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a zero grazing dairy unit.

loans.name: Emeritha

texts.en:
Emeritha is 36 years old. She is married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and has been selling these foodstuffs for the past five years. 

Emeritha wants the loan to buy more potatoes, cassava and corn flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her already existing business of food sales.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra earns a living through her food vending business, selling home cooked snack foods to the people in her area. Her husband works as a fisherman. Sandra is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her food vending business like flour, sugar, cooking oil and butter, and nets for fishing. In the future, Sandra dreams of expanding their business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil and butter, and nets for fishing.

loans.name: Nyadzua

texts.en:
This is Nyadzua. She previously accessed a loan that she used to stock her business with sugar, tea, soft drinks and bakery products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in the family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 Kshs loan to buy additional food items, such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional food items, such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Telesphore

texts.en: Telesphore is 41 years old. He is married with two children. He sells different retail items and with this loan, he wants to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice and salt for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice and salt for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman, aged 40, with six children who attend school. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Agnes operates a water vending business, selling fresh water for sale from home to her neighbours. With the Kshs 45,000 she is requesting, she wants to construct a rental house and purchase building stones and cement for the foundation. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income and meet her family expenses.

loans.use: to construct a rental house, and purchase building stones and cement for laying the foundation.

loans.name: Mukulu

texts.en:
Mukulu is 58 years old, single, and the mother of two adult children. She has been running her business for a period of about 13 years, with a monthly income of KES.10,000.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans. She will use the entire loan amount to buy cooking oil, flour, cereals and sugar. 

She hopes to improve their living standard and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, cereals and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Elizaveta

texts.ru:
Елизавета замужем. Она занимается выращиванием овощей в открытом грунте уже 10 лет. Выращенную продукцию продает на рынке. Также закупает оптом фркукты для продажи на рвнке в розницу в течение года.

У Елизаветы сломались холодильник и стиральная машина. Она просит предоставить ей кредит 8,000 гривен для покупки новой техники.

Елизавета трудолюбивая и прилежная. Она планирует развивать свой бизнес дальше - построить теплицу для выращивания ранних помидоров.
texts.en: Elizaveta is married, and she has grown vegetables in an open field for ten years.  She sells her crops at a market.  She also buys fruit at wholesale and sells them at market at a markup during the year.  Elizaveta's refrigerator and washing machine have broken.  She is asking for a loan of 8,000 griven to buy new appliances.  Elizaveta is hardworking and diligent.  She plans to further develop her business, building a greenhouse to grow tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and washing machine

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a widow with seven children, who all attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Umazi operates a firewood vending business, selling from home to her village. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a mother of four adults and has been in active farming for 23 years and runs the farm. Her produce includes bananas ,maize, milk and eggs. She runs her farm with the help of one farmhand.

Grace has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. She will use the loan to buy piglets and try her hand at pig farming. She says her focus is to  run a pig farm and supply the rural market for better income to meet her family's needs.

She says she chose Juhudi Kilimo due to a favourable interest rate and faster loan disbursement.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudence is 52 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for six years. 

The loan she has requested will be used to buy more potatoes, rice and bananas to sell. Her profits will be used to expand her business. 

Gaudence appreciates the first loan, which motivated her to work hard.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, rice and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса замужем. Вот уже почти 20 лет как она ведет свой собственный бизнес - торгует женской одеждой на рынке. Лариса продает платья, кофты и блузи. Имеет постоянных клиентов. Бизнес идет хорошо. У Ларисы свое собственное место, что позволяет ей получать дополнительную прибыль, т.к. она не платит за аренду.

Лариса просит предоставить ей кредит 10,000 гривен на закупку весеннего товара. Она хочет обновить свой ассортимент и тем самым привлечь к себе покупателей.

Лариса - трудолюбивая и ответственная. Она планирует развивать свой бизнес дальше и улучшать жилищные условия своей семьи.
texts.en: Larisa is married and has run her own business for twenty years selling women's clothing at a market.  She sells dresses, blouses and jackets.  She has regular customers and her business is going well.  She owns the space where she sells her goods which allows her additional revenue since she doesn't pay rent.  Larisa is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH to buy spring inventory.  She wants to upgrade her current selection to draw more customers.  She is hard working and responsible.  She plans to expand her business further and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy spring inventory

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир 20 лет занимается тепличным бизнесом. На 70 сотках земли выращивает три урожая огурцов, помидор и баклажан. Таким образом он продает как ранние так и поздние овощи, что позволяет ему увелиичить свой доход

Владимир трудолюбивый, предприимчивый. Он имеет желание развивать свой бизнес дальше. Владимир строит еще одну теплицу. Ему нужно закупить семена -4000грн, пленку - 6800грн, а также сделать ремонт существующих теплиц 1200 грн. Владимир сможет получить доход с продажи ранних огурцов, помодор, баклажанов и заработает на нужды семьи и бизнеса.
texts.en: Vladimir's business has been greenhouses for twenty years.  He grows three crops of cucumbers, tomatoes and eggplant on seventy acres of land.  Through this method, he is able to grow vegetables both early in the season, and late.  His hardworking and enterprising nature allow him to increase his income.  He has a desire to expand his business further.  Vladimir is building an additional greenhouse.  He needs 4,000 UAH to buy seeds, 6,800 for plastic, and 1,200 to make repairs to existing greenhouses. Vladimir will be able to receive income from early crops of cucumbers, tomatoes and eggplants and will save money for the needs of his business and family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and plastic to make minor greenhouse repairs

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva  is 20 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, Eva has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, flour, rice and soap. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for resale at her store, and will help Eva to generate greater profits, increase capital, and improve her family's standard of living. Eva hopes in the future, she will be able to educate her children. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more items for resale at her store.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 24 years old. She is married with one child who is two years old. Claudine sells clothes. With the loan, she wants to add more pants, vests, and socks for sale. The profits expected will be used for renovating her house. She is very happy with the previous loan that was given, which she believes was a changing factor in her business, More dozens of clothes were sold.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale in the business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 54, is a married woman with five kids. Four of her children still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a fruit and vegetable stall. She sells at a market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs to the place where she operates her business. 

With a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, Fatuma wants to purchase oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine, a 34-year-old married mother of five children between the ages of 3 and 14, all in school, has been selling bed sheets for four years. With this loan, she wants to buy more bed sheets to sell. She will use the profits to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman, age 35, and has not been blessed with children. Together with her husband, who is a teacher, they own a house that has electricity and piped water. 

For four years, Esther has operated a poultry vending business, selling from home to restaurant operators and her neighbours. She dreams of buying land and farming in the future. 

With the loan of Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed for resale.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional tobacco to sell.

Evangeline successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business

NWTF is re-listing Evangeline's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.en: Marcelline is 32 years old. She sells spare parts and has been in the business for five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more engine oil, brake oil and other spare parts for resale. The profits from the business will be used to expand the business’ volume through reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy more engine oil, brake oil and other spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29 years old. She owns a butchery and has been selling meat for eight years. She is married with two children. 

With the loan, she will buy more meats for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more meats for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase compost, fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Sara Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sara, tiene una venta de pupuseria. Ella tiene 33 años, está acompañada, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia. El negocio lo posee hace tres años  y lo inicio con su compañero de vida, lo realiza los sábados y domingos de 2:00 pm a 7:00 pm.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una plancha para hacer pupusas, también los ingredientes para elaborarlas tales como: aceite, carne, quesillo, entre otros. Esto le ayudara a incrementar el capital y obtener calidad en el producto, aumentar la clientela. 
Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio, para tener mejores ingresos que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Sara has a business selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas). She is 33 years old, married, has two children and lives in her own home. She has had this business for three years, and she started it with her husband. She works Saturdays and Sundays from 2 to 7 pm.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of a griddle to make pupusas, as well as in the purchase of the ingredients to make them, such as oil, meat, cream cheese, etc. This will help her increase her capital and gain quality in the product to grow the clientele.

Her goal is to strengthen the business to have better revenues that will allow her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a griddle to make pupusas (stuffed tortillas), as well as oil, meat, and cream cheese.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture taken inside their house.

Khitam is a 31-year-old married woman with no children yet. Her husband has a cosmetics store, which is a profitable project and the only source of income for them.

Khitam wants to improve their living conditions in the house by making necessary repairs and some necessary improvements, such as painting and installing new doors. For this purpose, Khitam is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover these costs. Taking this loan will offer to Kitam and her husband suitable home conditions so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to repair her house and make some improvements.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence  is married with two children and her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more rice, spices, cooking oil and Irish potatoes. She doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She moves door to door selling her potato chips and sells on retail seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully-stocked restaurant and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, rice, spices and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: This is Bahati. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy chicks and chicken feed. She would like to apply for another loan, this time for Kshs 40,000, to establish another business of buying and reselling clothes. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 32 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have two children. Marie Chantal sells clothes and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, she will buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 51 year old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as a self-oriented man and faithful man. He operates a taxi where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a favorable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the poor road network. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to pay for the servicing of the taxi. His business goal is to own more taxis within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay for servicing of the van.

loans.name: Jose Adali

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo y por la buena atención que la empresa le brinda. Este le servirá para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas para cultivar el maíz y frijol.
El manifiesta que con el crédito anterior, le permitió comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo. Han cambiado las circunstancias familiares ya que a aportado para los estudios de sus hijos y la alimentación para su hogar.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting a new loan because he needs more working capital and because his business is taking so much of his attention. This will go to purchase compost, insecticides, herbicides, and pest-control to cultivate corn and beans.

The previous loan allowed him to purchase agricultural tools for farming. His family circumstances have changed because the business has contributed to his children's schooling and to supporting the household.

loans.use: purchase compost, insecticides, herbicides, and pest-control to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose would like to apply for another KES 50,000 loan to buy additional bales of shoes and clothing to sell. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. 

Rose's profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase bales of shoes and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita más capital de trabajo. Este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol.
Con el crédito anterior, considera le permitió adquirir insumos agrícolas para el cultivo. Las condiciones de vida han mejorado, ya que le ha permitido aportar a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando y con la alimentación en el hogar.
texts.en:
Teresa needs to take out a new loan because she needs more working capital. This will allow her to purchase compost, herbicides, insecticides, and pest-control to farm corn and beans.

With the previous loan, she was able to acquire agricultural supplies for farming. Her living conditions have improved because the business has allowed her to contribute to her children so they can continue studying as well as to the household expenses.

loans.use: purchase compost, herbicides, insecticides, and pest-control for farming.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 33 and engaged to be married. She has been working as a tailor for six years. Her business has developed in a very good way, and she is well known in her region now. She has left the library that she used to work at to better respond to her customers' requests.

Linda has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. She plans to use the loan to do necessary maintenance to her future family house. She is getting married soon and hopes to make a small, beautiful family of her own.

Linda is very proud of herself and the level she has reached in her business. She hopes to keep expanding it and increasing her income. She also hopes that she is able to move her business from her house one day to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance to her future family house

loans.name: Blanca Elba

texts.es:
Blanca, solicita un nuevo préstamo, para mejorar su negocio de ventas de tortillas, así poder obtener más producción e ingresos para el hogar. Este le permitirá comprar maíz, leña y cal, para elaborar las tortillas. 
Con el crédito anterior pudo mejorar su venta y aumento la clientela. Las condiciones económicas mejoraron, ya que adquirió una plancha para las tortillas y pupusas.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting a new loan to improve her business of selling tortillas so that she will be able to increase production and income for her home. This loan will allow her to purchase corn, firewood, and lime for making tortillas.

With the previous loan she was able to improve sales and grow her clientele. Her economic conditions improved because she acquired a griddle for making tortillas and pupusas (stuffed tortillas).

loans.use: purchase corn, firewood, and lime for making tortillas.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 35-year-old married Palestinian woman, mother of three children and expecting her fourth child.

She has been working in agriculture for 20 years. Rima is a hard worker and is putting a lot of effort into supporting her family and expanding her business.

Rima is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to prepare for her expected baby needs and requests, and pay for the hospital fees.

This will be her first cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, and she hopes that the future experience with Al Majmoua will be invested in expanding her business capital and working zone.

loans.use: to prepare for her expected baby needs and requests.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 40-years-old and married with four children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Evangeline has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from doing manicures and pedicures.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a 30 year old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as an understanding, caring and loving woman. She operates a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is having insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 40,000 Kes loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a boutique within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She paid back her first loan of 30,000 Kes successfully.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Dayssy Del Rosario

texts.es:
Dayssy, solicita un nuevo crédito, el cual lo necesita para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de mariscos.  Este le ayudara para  la compra de pescado, camarón entre otros.
Con el préstamo anterior  sus ingresos han ido mejorando, ya que las ventas han estado bastante bien  y hoy sus hijos cuentan con una mejor calidad de vida, también económicamente ya que posee una clientela estable.
texts.en:
Dayssy is requesting a new loan which she will invest in her seafood business. This will help her buy fish, shrimp, etc.

Her income has been increasing since her previous loan as her sales have been quite good and today her children have a better quality of life. She is also doing better financially since she has a stable clientele.

loans.use: purchase fish, shrimp, etc.

loans.name: Tujisaindiye Group

texts.en:
Rinah is a member of Tujisaindiye Group in the Teso District. She is pictured with 22 One Acre Fund farmers, 14 women and 8 men. Rinah is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for a ½ acre of millet, sorghum and sweet potato cultivation. Rinah is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Rinah managed to harvest six bags of maize on two acres of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes to harvest even more! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and invest in livestock. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Rinah’s group members will take input loans of a ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 11 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato.

loans.name: Charity's Group

texts.en:
Charity's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Charity is 18 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Charity has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells salt, sugar, washing powder and eggs. 

To help expand her business, Charity has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to start purchasing other items to sell, and will help Charity to generate greater profits and enlarge the business. Charity hopes that in the future she will be able to start another business. 

Charity is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to start purchasing other inventory items to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is taking out another Kiva loan, this time in the amount of KES 50,000. The previous loan enabled her to double her monthly income which has been of great help to her family.  With the new loan she wants to expand her charcoal business and purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Jose Romeo

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita más capital de trabajo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol. Este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, para llevar acabo el cultivo. 
Con el crédito anterior le ayudo para comprar insumos agrícolas  y con las ganancias ha podido  aportar a su familia. Él quiere construir su propia vivienda para darle una mejor estabilidad de vida a su hogar.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting a new loan because he needs more working capital to grow corn and beans. This will allow him to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to aid in the cultivation of his crops.

His previous loan helped him buy agricultural supplies and with the income he has been able to support his family. He wants to build his own home to provide a more stable home life for his family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Assoumpta

texts.en: Assoumpta is 39 years old. She sells retail items and has been selling different items for the past four years. She wants a loan to buy more sugar, rice and beans for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same. She is very thankful for the previous loan that she obtained which helped her to increase the volume of her sales.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and beans for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 32 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Irene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is taking out another Kiva loan of 30,000 KES for personal use. With the loan, she plans to purchase water pipes and pay for labor to install piped water in her house. She is grateful for the opportunity that Kiva is giving her as she will be able to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes and pay for labor to install them in her house.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion is married with four children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling green bananas.  She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.  She has been in this business for 10 years and sells to all categories of people.  She generates additional income through renting rooms. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler, to start going to villages, and also to educate her children up to a university level. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Ana Dalinda

texts.es:
Ana, requiere optar un nuevo préstamo, porque no tiene dinero y quiere surtir el negocio.  Este le permitirá para comprar ropa de temporada, bolsos, material para bisutería, cosméticos  entre otros.
Con el crédito anterior, le ha permitido obtener ganancias con las cuales cancela los pagos y ayuda para los gastos del hogar. Las condiciones familiares se han mantenido por las mismas entradas de dinero.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan because she doesn't have any money and she wants to stock her business. This will allow her to buy seasonal clothing, handbags, costume jewelry, cosmetics, etc.

Her previous loan allowed her to obtain income with which she is paying off her debt and helping with the household expenses.  She is also providing for her family with the same income.

loans.use: buy seasonal clothing, handbags, costume jewelry, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is 64 years old, married and has 14 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Isidra has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Isidra has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials like fabric, thread, and others supplies.

Isidra has been in this business for fourty years. In the future, Isidra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like fabric, thread and others supplies.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 61 years old and widowed with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Josefina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock.

Josefina has been raising livestock for six years and also earns additional income from running a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock

loans.name: Reham
