The loan will be used to pay rent for his shop and will help Hassan to generate greater profits and increase the family's income. Hassan hopes that, in the future, he will be able to buy land. 

Hassan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Hassan, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to pay rent for his retail store.

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
Sory is 44 years old and a mother of six children living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. Two of her children are students and still count on her for support. She earns a living from growing two hectares of rice. Sory has grown rice for 10 years and earns up to 19,700 KHR per day. 

Sory’s first loan with VisionFund helped to support her business better and improved her livelihood at a good pace. For this new loan, she has formed a group of two and is acting as the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy rice seed and to pay her farmland leasing fee. She hopes to gain more income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and to pay her farmland leasing fee

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 38-year-old married man with six children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has a bicycle spare parts business, which he has operated for over seven years. He also has a sugarcane plantation, and he uses the sugar cane to brew alcohol. The business is rural-based, and he started it to get daily income to enable a smooth running of his family and serve the people of the area, since he is a mechanic.

He would like to construct a good permanent house for residence despite the poor road network that hinders his business operations. Micheal intends to use the loan to buy bicycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
"Sarah's Group" is comprised of 3 hard working women. Sarah  is 21 years old and lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Sarah  has been working hard to manage her business selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add to the business and buy more charcoal to sell. It will help Sarah  to generate greater profits and help generate income. Sarah  hopes that in the future she will be able to pay tuition for her children. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add in the business and buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Suzan's Group

texts.en:
Suzan is 18 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Suzan has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, flour, rice and other goods. 

To help expand her business, Suzan has requested a loan of 800000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items such as sugar and rice to sell, and will help Suzan to generate greater profits. Suzan hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her capital and build a home. 

Suzan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more items such as sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anadelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Anadeila works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling school supplies. Anadeila is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell for her business.

Anadeila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell for her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad will use this loan to purchase a new boat engine for 6,000,000 IDR and eight fishing nets, each for 500,000 IDR. He needs a bigger boat engine to go further into the sea to catch more fish. Ahmad goes to the sea everyday, and he catches a lot of fish. The price for 1 kg of fish is 10,000 to 12,000 IDR, depending on the type of fish.

Ahmad hopes, with the new boat engine and new fishing net, that he can catch more fish and earn more money so he can make his dream come true: to buy a new boat.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat engine and nets

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a  ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.  Mary Jane requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of read- to-wear items to sell.  Mary Jane has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Madaliza

texts.en:
Madaliza is 41 years old, married with seven children. Four of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Madaliza has a fishing business in the Philippines. Madaliza requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Madaliza has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Madaliza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married and has a food production business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Thelma requested a loan of PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. Thelma has been in this business for 10 years now and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en: Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and one of her children goes to school. She has no additional family members. She sells chips at the market on a retail basis. She gets additional income from teaching. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy cooking oil, Irish potatoes and serving utensils. Her major business challenges are the ever-increasing prices of cooking oil and Irish potatoes, transportation and electricity. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes, cooking oil and serving utensils

loans.name: Angelika

texts.en: Angelika is a 42-year-old married woman with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a produce business where she sells beans and groundnuts, a business she has run for five years now. She also does farming and raises poultry to supplement her income. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and a motorcycle despite inadequate capital that is affecting her business growth. Angelika intends to use the loan to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a widow from a village in the Isingiro district with 8 children, 7 of them are in school. Her husband was a soldier in the Ugandan armed forces and he died while on a mission in Congo. Annah was not compensated nor given her husband’s pension because she was illiterate and not aware of the procedure to follow to claim the benefits. Fortunately her husband left her a house with 3 rooms in a nearby trading centre. She has been depending on these rooms to earn income for survival and also to get school fees for the children. The rooms are getting old and require renovation. Because of this she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings to renovate these rooms so that she can continue earning rent for the survival of her family.

loans.use: To renovate her rental rooms.

loans.name: Wellars

texts.en: Wellars is 52 years old. He sells bananas and sorghum, which he has been doing for 15 years. Wellars is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more bananas and sorghum. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Jumwa's Group

texts.en: Jumwa is 44 years old with nine children. Her husband is also a farmer. Jumwa's agricultural business lacks capital to invest in good inputs and yields low harvests due to drought. She hopes to use the income from her KOMAZA tree farm to build a better house with tap water and electricity.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in Uganda. For the past two years, Susan has been working hard to manage her small charcoal business. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sacks of charcoal to sell, and will help Susan to generate greater profits and improve the family welfare. Susan hopes that in the future she will be able to start up another business selling vegetables. 

Susan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Juan Ángel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 66 años de edad, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad. Él vive junto a su esposa. Se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas y como posee un carretón vende panes los días sábados y domingos en la cancha de su comunidad y su esposa vende pupusas cerca de la iglesia. Ellos son muy trabajadores cada uno tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, él le traslada la cocina a su esposa para llevársela al puesto cerca de la iglesia lo hace en la espalda durante una distancia de 600 metros. 

El maíz para las pupusas lo obtiene de su cosecha y los demás insumos como chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, pollo, pan lo adquiere en la ciudad dos veces a la semana; para llegar ahí camina seis kilómetros hasta llegar a la carretera y de ahí aborda un autobús. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para duplicar la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, loroco, 20 libras de pollo; para aprovechar las festividades religiosas, porque siempre se quedan sin venta muy rápido. Su objetivo, es comprar otro carretón, debido a que el que posee no le sirve mucho.
texts.en:
Juan is 66 years old, has two adult children and lives with his wife.  Juan makes a living doing agricultural work and, because he has a small cart, he sells bread on the square in his community.  His wife also sells stuffed tortillas near the church.  Both Juan and his wife are very hard-working and they have been doing this for twenty years.  Juan carries all the kitchen equipment of on his to back to his wife's selling post near the church, 600 metres from their home.

They grow their own corn for the tortillas and the other supplies, such as the chicharrones, beans, cheese tortillas, chicken and bread, they buy from the city twice a week.  They have to walk six kilometres to the main road where they then take the bus to the city.

Juan is applying for a loan from "Fundación Campo" so he can buy twice the usual quantity of chicharrones, cheese tortillas and loroco and 20 lbs of chicken.  This will allow him to take advantage of the upcoming religious festivals as he has always runs out of supplies very quickly.  Juan's objective is to buy another cart as his current one is not the best.

loans.use: to buy double the usual quantity of chicharrones, cheese tortillas and loroco and 20 lbs of chicken - this will allow Juan to take advantage of the religious festivals as he allows runs out of stock very quickly.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Luis Manuel de 48 años es casado y padre de 3 hijos que aun dependen económicamente de su hijo el menor estudia la educación básica y dos de ellos la media superior. El señor Luis Manuel desde muy pequeño le ayudaba a su padre de oficio herrero en los trabajos que el tenía que hacer y el fue desarrollando un gusto y habilidad para diseñar puertas, ventanas, canceles y todo  trabajo de herrería que su padre le solicitaran. Con el tiempo él se caso y formo su propia familia y aun seguía trabajando con su papa y el tenia un sueño que era tener su propio taller de herrería y soldadura durante muchos años el su esposa ahorraron dinero y se privaron de muchas cosas para poder tener su propio negocio iniciaron una maquina de soldar unas protecciones y puertas metálicas para reparar, su negocio ha crecido mucho en estos  9  años que tiene de operar el negocio y tiene una necesidad que es comprar una camioneta para poder entregar los pedidos como portones, puertas, ventanas, vitrinas de aluminio y más. El ya tiene un ahorro para poder comprarle pero le hace falta un poco de dinero y agradece el apoyo que le puedan dar.
texts.en: Luis Manuel is married and has three children who are still dependent on him.  His youngest son is in primary and the others are in secondary school.  Since he was very young, Luis helped his father in his work as an ironmonger.  As a result Luis grew a liking for and the skills to design doors, windows, patio doors and to do all other kinds of work that Luis's father used to do.  As time went on, Luis married and had his own family but he continued working alongside his father.  By now he had a dream of opening his own ironmongery and welding workshop so for many years Luis and his wife went without certain things as they saved up money to start a business.  Luis started off with just equipment for welding and repairing metal doors but his business has grown a lot since he started the business nine years ago.  He now needs a small van so that he can deliver orders such as doors, windows, gates, shop windows and the like.  Luis has saved up money to buy the car but he just needs a little more.  He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy machinery.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Marta lleva dos años de tener su propio negocio el cual le ha dado buenos resultados, vende variedad de artículos como ser: ropa de niño, blusas y pantalones, útiles escolares, golosinas como dulces, galletas y otros, zapatos y productos plásticos. El negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa donde ya tiene una buena clientela. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 25,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de zapatos, pantalones y plásticos para surtir el negocio. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas. Su plan es tener siempre el negocio bien surtido y de los ingresos ayudar a su familia y vivir mejor.
texts.en: Marta is 51 years old.  She is a single mother and has three children.  She lives in a village in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  Marta has had her own business for two years and she has had good results with it.  She sells a variety of items, including children's clothes, blouses, trousers, school materials, sweets things like candy and biscuits and plastic products.  She runs the business out of her home and now has a good customer base.  She is applying for a loan of 25,000 Lempira that she will invest in buying shoes, trousers and plastics for her business.  This investment will help Marta to increase her sales.  Her plan is to keep the business well stocked and to use her income to help her family to live better.

loans.use: to buy shoes, trousers and plastic to stock up her business.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr:
Libérate  fait partie du groupe Espoir et habite à Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Désiré un électricien. Ensemble ils sont 6 enfants âgés de 9 à 20 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce du charbon de bois depuis 15 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de charbon de bois à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait continuer à scolariser ses enfants pour qu’ils se développent.
texts.en:
Libérate is part of the Espoir (Hope) group and lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Desire, an electrician, with whom she had six children aged 9 to 20 years, all attending school.

She has been in the charcoal retail business for the past 15 years.

She is on her fourth credit loan with Turame. Once the KIVA loan is obtained, she will increase her capital and buy a large amount of charcoal for resale so as to earn more.

In coming years, she would like to further her children's development through education.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy a large quantity of charcoal for resale so as to earn more.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Juan de 73 años de edad es viudo desde hace 8 años,es padre de 8 hijos que ya formaron su propio hogaR.Durante años el trabajo mucho para darles una educación a sus hijos y descuido su patrimonio ya que el pensaba tanto en que sus hijos tuvieran una  educación de calidad y nunca pensó en que el llegaría a la vejez y no tendría un patrimonio seguro donde pasar los últimos años de su vida. El Sr. Juan solicita el apoyo para la construcción de un cuarto de concreto y asi no pasar por las inclemencias del tiempo. El trabaja para el municipio barriendo calles y les agradece de antemano el apoyo que le puedan brindar para avanzar la construcción de su cuarto y a futuro poder tener un lugar digno donde pasar sus últimos días.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is 73 years old and has been a widower for eight years. He is a father to eight children who have all moved out of the family home. For years, he worked hard to provide his children with an education, neglecting his own financial wellbeing to instead focus on ensuring that his children received a good education. He never imagined he would become old and lack somewhere safe to live out the last years of his life. 

Juan is requesting help to build a concrete room so that he isn't affected by bad weather. He works for the town council sweeping the streets, and would like to give his thanks in advance for any support you can give him to help him build a room and have a dignified place to spend his last days in the future.

loans.use: to build a room onto his house.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto es casado y padre de dos hijos trabaja como taxista en las calles subiendo pasajeros y llevándolos a su destino durante diez horas diarias, el es su propio jefe, puesto que es el propietario del taxi en el que trabaja. El vive en una casa de interés social desde hace 9 años y estas casas son muy pequeñas que el ha tenido que ir construyendo con ahorros propios para ampliar su casa el tiene la necesidad de terminar un cuarto que inicio la construcción de el hace un año y requiere el apoyo para terminar de levantar una barda y colocar la losa de concreto.
texts.en: Roberto is married and the father of two children. He works as a taxi driver in the streets, carrying passengers to their destinations for ten hours a day. He is his own boss, since he is the owner of the taxi that he works with. He has lived in a a subsidized house for 9 years. They are very small and he has had to use savings to add on to it. He needs to finish a room that he started building a year ago and he needs help to finish putting up a wall and putting in a concrete floor.

loans.use: to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras es un grupo de trabajo de 12 mujeres, que hoy se encuentra en su ciclo 6, donde cada una trabaja arduamente por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Mirna es la presidenta del comité,  ella se dedica a la costura, tiene una clientela ya formada, viene realizando esta actividad desde hace bastante tiempo. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener su negocio a pesar de los múltiples obstáculos que se le han presentado ella ha logrado salir adelante.
Doña Mirna solicita  este crédito para la compra de  diversos tipos de telas para realizar algunos vestidos que se le han solicitado.
texts.en: Mujeres Emprendedoras is a working group of 12 women who have been together for six years. Each of them works hard to succeed and help their family. Señora Mirna is the head of the committee, she works making clothes, and has an established customer base because she has done this job for a long time. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she has managed to keep her business afloat and move forward despite the many hurdles she has faced. Mirna is requesting this loan to buy various kinds of fabric to make dresses that customers have ordered from her.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es cliente nuevo en la fundación, es soltero y vive en la ciudad de Curuguaty. El es dueño de una despensa en la que trabaja hace 5 años.
El es una persona muy trabajadora que desea salir adelante, es por eso que trata de crecer y de innovar siempre a sus clientes. El quiere poder comprar artículos de mercería, como ser prendas, calzados, artículos en general para que así su esposa lo ayude en esa área, es por eso que solicita de este crédito.
Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a new client in the foundation. He is single and lives in the city of Curuguaty. He is the owner of a store where he has worked for 5 years.  

He is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead. That is why he tries to grow and innovate for his customers. He wants to be able to buy merchandise items such as clothing, shoes, and general articles so that his wife can help him in that area. That is why he is asking for this loan.  

He is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Las Ponderosas Group

texts.es:
Este es un numeroso grupo de la ciudad de Luque, el cual se encuentra en su ciclo numero 12. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que quieren salir adelante y dar a sus hijos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La Sra. Orzulina es una miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura, y cuenta que gracias al buen trabajo que hace, ya se ha ganado una buena clientela que siempre le da mucho trabajo y con lo cual mantiene a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre se destaca.
Solicita una ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y con lo que podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This is a large group in the city of Luque. Right now, it is in its 12th cycle. They are very hardworking women who want to get ahead and give their children what they were unable to have. 

Orzulina is a member of this group. She sews and relates that thanks to the good work she does, she has earned a good clientele. They give her a lot of work and with that she supports her family. She is a very hardworking person who always stands out. 

She is asking for help to be able to invest in buying fabrics, threads, elastic and more to be able to keep working and filling her customers' orders. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving and with which she will be able to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastic, and more.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Aty Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa Aty es el grupo de la ciudad de Concepción, están en su ciclo numero 1, donde ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y se ayudan para dar un futuro mejor a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Leonarda hace toda la parte de confitería, por las tardes, y los domingos prepara variadas comidas en venta para el almuerzo. También se debe destacar el trabajo y esfuerzo que ella pone por salir adelante y progresar.
La Sra. Leonarda Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para la compra de mas ingredientes para poder fabricar mas comestibles, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa Aty is a group in the city of Concepción, and this is their first year together. They are learning to work together and support one another to provide their families with a better future.

One of the members is Señora Leonarda. She spends her afternoons making desserts and on Sundays prepares different kinds of foods to sell at lunchtime. She works hard and puts in a lot of effort to succeed and make progress. Leonarda is requesting this loan to buy more ingredients to make food. This will help her to cement her business plan and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a fifty four year old married man with nine children living in Kasese,Uganda.  He has been teaching for twenty four years, working five days a week and ten hours a day.

He was inspired by the fact that he likes educating children to become good citizens of Uganda.  A low salary and unfavorable working conditions are major threats to his career while he dreams of educating his children up to the University and of setting up a business for retirement.  Samuel intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a thirty two year old married woman with tree children living in Kasese,Uganda.  She has been in the salon business for four years, working seven days a week and nine hours a day.  Her business is located at the border of the Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda thus attracts a large number of customers.  

Customer preferences coupled with inadequate services is a major threat to her business since she risks being obsolete if she does not change to modern trades.   Her dream is a modern salon.   Rosemary intends to use the loan to buy hair weaves and oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and oil to sell.

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en:
Paskali is a 41 year old man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He operates a retail shop where he gets his main income but in addition he practices farming.

A good father that he is he desires to educate his children up to the University and set up a sustainable income generating activities for each of them.  Inadequate capital poses a challenge to his business growth while his plan is to trade in wholesale.  Paskali intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado Kuña Guapa  está en su ciclo número 8º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas quieren dar a sus familias todo lo que no pudieron tener y de esa forma evitar que pasen por necesidades.
La Sra. Elsa es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo ha ayudado a su familia y les ha dado todo lo que necesitan para una buena vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles y también a la costura, y con estos trabajos está saliendo adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás, para poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee is in its eighth year together, and is a program formed by a committee of women. They all work and support one another to succeed. They want to provide their families with all the things they never had and prevent them from going without.

Señora Elsa is a very hard-working, selfless person. Through a lot of hard work and effort she has helped her family and given them everything they need to have a good life. She sells food and also makes clothes, and through this work, she is moving forward. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other items, so that she can keep working as she has done up until now.

loans.use: to buy clothing, thread, elastic and other items.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a thirty three year old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Four years ago he decided to start a retail business in order to meet his daily family expenses since farming is seasonal.  

Unpredictable weather changes and the high cost of rent are his major challenges.  His business plan is to own a wholesale shop and expand his farming activities.  Isaac intends to use the loan to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Victoriosas está en su tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, donde cada una ha puesto todo de sí para poder salir adelante y dar a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan.
Maxima tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, es gracias a este negocio que ella está creciendo y da a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Su negocio está creciendo y eso la pone muy feliz, ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, productos a granel, leche, frutas y demás, para poder tener bien surtido su negocio y seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mujeres Victoriosas [Victorious Women] is in its third cycle of the enterprising women program. All members have contributed greatly in order to get ahead and give their children everything they might need.

Máxima has a well-stocked grocery store. She works every day, starting early in the morning. Thanks to this business, she is growing and giving her family everything they need. The business is expanding, which makes her happy since it is her main source of income.

Máxima is requesting a loan to invest it in buying vegetables, milk, fruits and other supplies in bulk and stock her business in order to offer a good assortment to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, milk, fruits and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a thirty two year old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.  For two years now he has been selling fresh foods in the market and also running a general merchandise shop.

High license fees and price fluctuation are his hardships.  His plan is to trade in wholesale and to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications.  Edward intends to use the loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La Sra. Justina, tiene dos hijos, ambos Estudiante Universitarios, ya mayores que la ayudan en su trabajo. Justina tiene dos canchas de vóley en su casa donde además tiene una cantina donde vende comidas y bebidas. El producto que más vende son las bebidas entre cervezas y gaseosas.
Gracias al trabajo que está realizando logro ampliar su cantina para una mejor comodidad para los clientes. Y ayuda a sus hijos para seguir sus estudios universitarios.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, como ser gaseosas, cervezas, vinos y demás, y con esto podrá seguir dando buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Justina has two adult children. Both of them are studying at the university and help her with her job. Justina owns two volleyball courts located at home and runs a canteen where she sells food and beverages. The products she sells the most are beverages, mainly beer and sodas. Thanks to her hard work, she managed to expand her canteen in order to offer her customers a more comfortable space. Besides, she is helping her children receive a university degree.

Justina is requesting a loan to buy sodas, beer, wine and other types of beverages that will help her offer a good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy different types of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
La señora Victorina tiene 55 años, esta casada desde hace mucho tiempo con el señor Gervasio, con quien tiene hijos, pero que ya son todos mayores e independientes, ellos son de la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Victorina tiene una cantina en un colegio, y ya hace varios años que se dedica a este rubro y le va muy bien. Su esposo se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chipas, tiene una pequeña industria en su casa en donde diariamente produce y vende cierta cantidad de chipas. Tienen  mucha clientela en la zona ya que son conocidos. Gracias a estas actividades ellos han podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto.
La Sra. Victorina solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su cantina, como ser bebidas, golosinas, jugos y demás, para que con ello tenga bien surtida su cantina.
texts.en:
Señora Victorina is 55 years old and has been married to Señor Gervasio for many years, with whom she has children who are all grown-up and independent. They are from the city of Encarnación.

Señora Victorina has a canteen in a school. She has been doing this job for a long time, and it's going very well. Her husband makes a living making and selling chipa, a traditional cornbread made with cheese. He has a small workshop in their home where he produces and sells chipa every day. They have many customers locally as they are well-known. Thanks to these activities they have been able to move forwards, support their family and pay any unexpected bills.

Victorina is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for her canteen, such as drinks, sweets, juices and other items so that it is well-stocked.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sweets, juices and other items.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Rosa Mistica está en su Primer Ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres de las señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Maria es una de las integrantes, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que sus ingresos son muy bajos, y están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, pero ella es consciente que a través del esfuerzo que hace podrá seguir creciendo. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza que hace por medio de las microfranquicias que ofrece la fundación.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de microfranquicia de limpieza, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y haciendo los productos de limpieza que vende. Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo todas las miembros, ya que les será de mucha ayuda, no solo a ellas, sino también a sus familias.
texts.en:
This is Rosa Mistica group's first year together and is made up of a committee of women who all work and support one another to succeed. They are taking part in a survey about eliminating poverty, and three of the members live below the poverty line.

Maria is one of the members, who, in her latest survey, had a level one poverty rating, meaning that her income is very low and are below the poverty line. However, she knows that through her hard work she can continue to grow. She makes a living selling cleaning products through micro-franchises offered by the foundation.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy a cleaning micro-franchise, which will enable her to keep working and making cleaning products, which she then sells. She is grateful for the opportunity that all the members are receiving as it will help them and their families a great deal.

loans.use: to buy a cleaning franchise to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 49 years old and single. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Anselma is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs and goods for her general store.

Anselma has been in the pig fattening business for 15 years and also earns additional income from her general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs and goods for her general store.

loans.name: Santa Teresa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Teresa está en su ciclo número tres del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que se esfuerzan por ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Salvadora es una de las integrantes del grupo, quien hace comidas para la venta. Cuenta que ya se hizo de muy buena clientela ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y son muy pedidas por sus clientes. Gracias a las ventas que hace da a su familia lo que necesitan para no tener que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirla en la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, pollo y demás insumos para poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que ella prepara.
texts.en:
The "Santa Teresa" group is on its third loan cycle on the "Women's Committee" programme. All the women work and help each other to move forward in life. These are all enterprising and hard-working women that put in the effort to help each other.
Salvadora is one member of the group and she makes food to sell. She tells us that she now has a good customer base as her food is delicious and in high-demand from her customers. Thanks to her sales, Salvadora is able to give her family everything they need so that they do not have to go without.
She is applying for the loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, chicken and other supplies so that she can continue to delight her customers with the delicious dishes that she prepares.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, chicken and other supplies.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is 30 years old and has two children. Analou is married and has two children who are in school.

Analou is in the agricultural business, raising hogs in the Philippines. Analou requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Analou has been in the hog raising business for twoyears now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns more income from her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Crisita dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling root crops.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Alma has been in this business for three years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store, like shampoo, groceries, etc. In the future, Alma would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco Javier de 64 años de edad, se ha dedicado por más de diez años a la venta de plantas forestales y ornamentales en su municipio, actividad con la que ha generado el sustento para su familia y la educación de sus tres hijos.
A pesar del fallecimiento de esposa hace algunos meses, este hombre asegura que su mayor sueño es poder seguir con su negocio ya que éste también era el deseo de su cónyuge.
Ama la naturaleza y asegura que desde niño aprendió sobre su trabajo gracias a que residió en el campo la mayor parte de su vida.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la adquisición de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes, con el objeto de aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Espera ver crecer su negocio y convertirlo en el vivero más reconocido de su localidad.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier is 64 years old and for more than ten years he has made a living selling forest and ornamental plants in his town. This work has generated enough money to support his family and pay for his children's education.
Even though his wife died a few months ago, Francisco says his biggest dream is to continue with the business as that is what she would have wanted.
Francisco loves the natural world and ever since he was a boy he has been learning about his work as he spent most of his life living in the countryside.
Francisco is currently applying for a loan that he will use to buy seeds, manure and fertilisers. His aim is to increase his sales and improve his living conditions.
He hopes to expand his business and to have the best nursery in town.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and fertilisers.

loans.name: Guillermo León

texts.es:
Guillermo de 36 años de edad, es un campesino dedicado a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias desde su juventud. Por las condiciones económicas de su familia no pudo acceder a la educación, por lo cual comenzó a laborar en el campo desde su adolescencia. Tras  la muerte de sus padres, Guillermo quedó encargado de todas las responsabilidades del hogar y de sus doce hermanos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y disciplina, logró sacar adelante a su familia, conformar un hogar con su esposa y su hijo de cinco años de edad. En la actualidad se dedica al cultivo de frutas, engorde de pollos  y a la lechería. Actividades que son el sustento para el sostenimiento y la educación de su familia.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de dos vacas  lecheras con el propósito de aumentar su capacidad de producción y mejorar los ingresos en su hogar.
El mayor sueño de Guillermo es poder comprarles a sus hermanos los derechos sobre la finca en la que reside, por ser una herencia familiar,
texts.en:
Guillermo is 36 years old. He is from the countryside and, since his youth, he has made a living working in agriculture and with livestock. Due to a lack of money in his family, Guillermo could not get an education and so has been working the fields since he was an adolescent. After his parents died, Guillermo was made responsible for the home and his twelve siblings. 
Thanks to his effort and self-discipline, he managed to help his family progress and he built a home with his wife and five-year-old son. Guillermo currently makes a living growing fruits, fattening chickens and producing milk. This work provides an income for his family and his children's education.
Guillermo is currently applying for a loan that he will use to buy two dairy cows. This will allow him to increase his production capacity and his household income.
Guillermo's biggest dream is to buy the rights to the land he lives on from his siblings, so that he can leave it to his own family.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a business of buying and selling herbal medicines and vitamins in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of herbal medicines and vitamins to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years. Carmelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of herbal medicine and vitamins to sell.

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Bintu. She is married and has four children aged 17, 14, 10 and 7. She has two additional dependents, who live with her for schooling.  In 2001, Bintu established her clothing and textile business. She began her business just to generate enough funds to support her children’s education. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 540,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 6,000,000. Bintu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy ladies trousers for SLL 1,500,000, suitcases for SLL 1,000,000 and napkins for SLL 500,000. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level. In the future, Bintu plans to buy more stock for her shop and to educate her kids. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Jitta

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Jitta. She is married and has two children aged 12 and 9. In 1996, Jitta established her cosmetics and drinks business. She began her business just to provide support to her husband in taking care of the home. Her business is located in the city centre and her main customers are men and women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 480,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan of SLL 6,250,000. Jitta has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional business stock. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock and capital levels. In the future, Jitta still maintains the plan of moving to Dubai. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 33-year-old woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a bar and a retail shop to earn a living and in addition to that she also has a lodge and cinema/football hall in order to meet her family's basic needs. She has a dream of having sustainable business and a healthy family despite inadequate capital. Florence intends to use the loan to buy beer, soda and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Iye

texts.en:
This is 60 year-old Iye. She is a widow and has two children aged 40 and 35. In 1983, Iye established her local goods (garri, pepper, groundnuts, palm oil etc.) business. She began her business because she did not go to school and because she was fostered by her aunt who is a business woman who introduced her to the business which is now her livelihood. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about  SLL 881,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000. Iye requires a loan in order to purchase five bags of garri, 10 bags of pepper, and 20 bags of groundnuts. 

In the future, Iye plans to improve on her existing business in order to save enough for her retirement age. Competition is her challenge.  The business that she is dealing with requires a lot of capital. She needs additional capital to add to her operating capital. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase five bags of garri, 10 bags of pepper, and 20 bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to set up a workshop in which to recharge batteries.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Basilia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like soft drinks, bread and other miscellaneous items.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Basilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like soft drinks, bread and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food market business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

Elena successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Elena's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Adassou

texts.fr: Revendeur de pure water à domicile, Adassou marié et père de famille  exerce cette activité depuis 1991. Pour mieux garder sa clientèle, il fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des sachets de pure water. Avec les profits, il désire ouvrir d’autres boutiques et assurer au mieux au besoin de la famille.
texts.en: A seller of "Pure Water" at home, Adassou is married and a father and has been running his business since 1991. In order to better keep his customers, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES so that he can buy "Pure Water". He would like to use the profits to open new shops and do his best to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy "Pure Water".

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr: Femme de 40ans, adjowavi est mère de 02 enfants tous à l’école. Ils sont âgés de 08 et 05ans. Pour pouvoir supporter les enfants et les aider à mieux terminer leurs études, elle revend des produits cosmétiques dans une boutique louée à cet effet et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des produits cosmétiques. Le profit de la vente lui permettra d’élargir son activité et assurer au mieux au besoin  de la famille.
texts.en: A 40-year-old woman, Adjowavi is a mother of 2 children who both go to school. They are 8 and 5 years old. In order to be able to provide for her children and help them to complete their studies successfully, she sells beauty products in a shop she has rented for this purpose. She gets her supplies in Lomé. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy beauty products. The profit from her sales will enable her to expand her business and do her best to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old and has nine children. Marilyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jorna

texts.en:
Jorna is 31 years old and single and works very hard to help her parents.

Jorna runs a rice retailer in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 57 years old and married with six children.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock for her general store like canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, milk, etc..

Lolita has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Lolita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store like canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita works hard to support her family. Margarita is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Margarita requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, spices, can goods, etc..

Margarita has been in this business for 29 years now.

In the future, Margarita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Igirubuntu Group

texts.fr:
Aline  fait partie du groupe Igirubuntu  et est une des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Elle est cliente de Turame depuis  5ans. Elle  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Honoré. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de  5 à  22 ans.

Elle faisait le commerce des habits   au marché central de Bujumbura. Elle a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de  5 000 000FBU (3205,18 $) par l’incendie.


Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  reconstituer son capital en achetant des  habits, à revendre pour  continuer de gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Aline is a member of the Igirubuntu group and one of the victims of the fire at the Central Market of Bujumbura. She has been a client of Turame for 5 years. She lives in Bujumbura and is married to Honoré. The couple have 5 children, aged between 5 and 22 years old.

She used to sell clothing at the Bujumbura Central Market. She has lost merchandise worth 5 000 000 francs ($ 3205,18) because of the fire. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will allow her to rebuild her capital by buying clothing for resale, so that she can continue to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi vit avec son conjoint mécanicien et leurs 03 enfants de 16ans, 05ans et 09mois à Lomé. Seuls les deux premiers sont  scolarisés. Elle est revendeuse de sacs et tissus dans un quartier de la ville et s’approvisionne chez les grossistes qui viennent de la CHINE. Elle désire ouvrir une boutique, assurer au mieux les besoins de la famille c’est pour cela elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES. Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra d’atteindre cet objectif. Elle est âgée de 40ans et a une ancienneté de 10ans dans l’activité.
texts.en: Ablavi lives with her mechanic spouse and their 3 children, aged 16, 5 and 9 months, in Lomé. The two eldest children attend school. She sells bags and fabrics in a district of town and gets her supplies from Chinese wholesalers. She would like to open a shop and do her best to provide for her family's needs, which is why she is requesting her first loan from WAGES. The profit earned from her sales will enable her to reach her goals. She is 40 years old and has 10 years experience in her line of work.

loans.use: to buy bags and fabrics.

loans.name: Elicita

texts.en:
Elicita is 56 years old, married with 3 children. 

She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business which is planting, harvesting, banana and vegetables to sell to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 8 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 49 years old and married with eight children, five of whom are in school.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling operation for Avon products in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional Avon products to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for 8 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to pay for her children to go to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon products to sell
